"keyword">from selenium "keyword">import webdriver "keyword">from selenium.webdriver.common.by "keyword">import By "keyword">from selenium.webdriver.support.ui "keyword">import WebDriverWait "keyword">from selenium.webdriver.support "keyword">import expected_conditions "keyword">as EC "keyword">from selenium.webdriver.chrome.options "keyword">import Options "keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import time "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import base64 "keyword">from dotenv "keyword">import load_dotenv "keyword">import requests "keyword">from PIL "keyword">import Image load_dotenv() print("=== SELENIUM SCREENSHOT APPROACH FOR HEADSTONE RHYME EXTRACTION ===") print("Strategy: Use Selenium to screenshot headstone images directly "keyword">from webpage") print("Target: Economic Crunch (1987) - oldest discontinued flavor headstone rhyme\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # STEP 1: Use Selenium to navigate to graveyard "keyword">and screenshot Economic Crunch headstone print("=== STEP 1: SELENIUM HEADSTONE SCREENSHOT CAPTURE ===\n") "keyword">try: # Set up Chrome options chrome_options = Options() chrome_options.add_argument(&#x27;--headless') chrome_options.add_argument(&#x27;--no-sandbox') chrome_options.add_argument(&#x27;--disable-dev-shm-usage') chrome_options.add_argument(&#x27;--disable-gpu') chrome_options.add_argument(&#x27;--window-size=1920,1080') chrome_options.add_argument(&#x27;--user-agent=Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36') print("Initializing Chrome WebDriver "keyword">for screenshot capture...") driver = webdriver.Chrome(options=chrome_options) # Navigate to the graveyard page graveyard_url = "https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/flavor-graveyard" print(f"Navigating to: {graveyard_url}") driver.get(graveyard_url) time.sleep(5) # Wait "keyword">for page to load print(f"Page loaded: {driver.title}") print(f"Current URL: {driver.current_url}") # Look "keyword">for Economic Crunch headstone image print("\nSearching "keyword">for Economic Crunch headstone image...") # Try multiple strategies to find the Economic Crunch headstone headstone_found = "keyword">False headstone_element = "keyword">None # Strategy 1: Look "keyword">for image "keyword">with Economic Crunch "keyword">in alt text "keyword">try: headstone_element = driver.find_element(By.XPATH, "//img[contains(@alt, &#x27;Economic Crunch')]") print("‚úì Found Economic Crunch headstone by alt text") headstone_found = "keyword">True "keyword">except: print("Strategy 1 failed: No image found "keyword">with Economic Crunch alt text") # Strategy 2: Look "keyword">for image "keyword">with economic_crunch "keyword">in src "keyword">if "keyword">not headstone_found: "keyword">try: headstone_element = driver.find_element(By.XPATH, "//img[contains(@src, &#x27;economic_crunch')]") print("‚úì Found Economic Crunch headstone by src filename") headstone_found = "keyword">True "keyword">except: print("Strategy 2 failed: No image found "keyword">with economic_crunch "keyword">in src") # Strategy 3: Look "keyword">for text containing Economic Crunch "keyword">and find nearby image "keyword">if "keyword">not headstone_found: "keyword">try: # Find text element containing "Economic Crunch" text_element = driver.find_element(By.XPATH, "//*[contains(text(), &#x27;Economic Crunch')]") print("‚úì Found Economic Crunch text element") # Look "keyword">for image "keyword">in the same parent "keyword">or nearby parent = text_element.find_element(By.XPATH, "./ancestor::*[1]") headstone_element = parent.find_element(By.TAG_NAME, "img") print("‚úì Found Economic Crunch headstone near text element") headstone_found = "keyword">True "keyword">except: print("Strategy 3 failed: Could "keyword">not find image near Economic Crunch text") # Strategy 4: Look "keyword">for all graveyard images "keyword">and identify Economic Crunch "keyword">if "keyword">not headstone_found: "keyword">try: # Find all images that might be headstones all_images = driver.find_elements(By.XPATH, "//img[contains(@src, &#x27;tombstone') "keyword">or contains(@src, 'graveyard') "keyword">or contains(@alt, 'tombstone')]") print(f"Found {len(all_images)} potential headstone images") "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(all_images): src = img.get_attribute(&#x27;src') "keyword">or '' alt = img.get_attribute(&#x27;alt') "keyword">or '' print(f" Image {i+1}: src={src[:100]}..., alt={alt}") "keyword">if &#x27;economic_crunch' "keyword">in src.lower() "keyword">or 'economic crunch' "keyword">in alt.lower(): headstone_element = img print(f"‚úì Found Economic Crunch headstone (Image {i+1})") headstone_found = "keyword">True "keyword">break "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"Strategy 4 failed: {e}") "keyword">if headstone_found "keyword">and headstone_element: print("\n=== CAPTURING HEADSTONE SCREENSHOT ===\n") # Get image details img_src = headstone_element.get_attribute(&#x27;src') img_alt = headstone_element.get_attribute(&#x27;alt') print(f"Headstone image source: {img_src}") print(f"Headstone alt text: {img_alt}") # Scroll to the image to ensure it's visible driver.execute_script("arguments[0].scrollIntoView(true);", headstone_element) time.sleep(2) # Take screenshot of the specific element screenshot_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;economic_crunch_headstone_screenshot.png') "keyword">try: # Method 1: Element screenshot (preferred) headstone_element.screenshot(screenshot_path) print(f"‚úì Element screenshot saved to: {screenshot_path}") "keyword">except: # Method 2: Full page screenshot then crop (fallback) print("Element screenshot failed, trying full page screenshot...") full_screenshot_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;full_page_screenshot.png') driver.save_screenshot(full_screenshot_path) # Get element location "keyword">and size "keyword">for cropping location = headstone_element.location size = headstone_element.size print(f"Element location: {location}") print(f"Element size: {size}") # Crop the full screenshot to get just the headstone "keyword">try: "keyword">with Image.open(full_screenshot_path) "keyword">as img: left = location[&#x27;x'] top = location[&#x27;y'] right = left + size[&#x27;width'] bottom = top + size[&#x27;height'] cropped = img.crop((left, top, right, bottom)) cropped.save(screenshot_path) print(f"‚úì Cropped screenshot saved to: {screenshot_path}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as crop_error: print(f"Cropping failed: {crop_error}") # Use full screenshot "keyword">as fallback screenshot_path = full_screenshot_path print(f"Using full page screenshot: {screenshot_path}") # Verify screenshot file "keyword">if os.path.exists(screenshot_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(screenshot_path) print(f"Screenshot file size: {file_size:,} bytes") # Verify it's a valid image "keyword">try: "keyword">with Image.open(screenshot_path) "keyword">as img: print(f"Screenshot dimensions: {img.size[0]} x {img.size[1]} pixels") print(f"Screenshot format: {img.format}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as verify_error: print(f"Screenshot verification error: {verify_error}") # STEP 2: Analyze screenshot "keyword">with GPT-4o Vision print(f"\n=== STEP 2: GPT-4O VISION ANALYSIS OF HEADSTONE SCREENSHOT ===\n") "keyword">if os.path.exists(screenshot_path): print(f"Analyzing screenshot: {screenshot_path}") # Encode screenshot to base64 "keyword">with open(screenshot_path, "rb") "keyword">as f: img_base64 = base64.b64encode(f.read()).decode("utf-8") # Determine image format "keyword">for data URL img_format = "png" "keyword">if screenshot_path.endswith(&#x27;.png') "keyword">else "jpeg" data_url = f"data:image/{img_format};base64,{img_base64}" # Create comprehensive prompt "keyword">for rhyme extraction prompt = ( "This "keyword">is a screenshot of a Ben & Jerry&#x27;s flavor graveyard headstone "keyword">for Economic Crunch, which "keyword">is the oldest discontinued Ben & Jerry's flavor (1987). " "Please analyze this headstone image very carefully "keyword">and extract ALL visible text, "keyword">with special focus on:\n\n" "1. **Flavor Name Confirmation**: Verify this "keyword">is indeed Economic Crunch\n" "2. **Complete Rhyme/Poem Text**: Extract the ENTIRE rhyme "keyword">or poem written on the headstone - this "keyword">is the most critical part\n" "3. **Last Line Identification**: Clearly identify which line "keyword">is the FINAL/LAST line of the rhyme\n" "4. **All Other Text**: Any dates, additional text, "keyword">or inscriptions\n\n" "IMPORTANT: Please transcribe the rhyme text EXACTLY "keyword">as it appears, preserving:\n" "- Every word "keyword">and punctuation mark\n" "- Line breaks "keyword">and verse structure\n" "- Capitalization "keyword">as shown\n\n" "The rhyme/poem "keyword">is the main content we need - please be very thorough "keyword">in extracting every line.\n\n" "Format your response clearly "keyword">as:\n" "## Headstone Identification\n" "[Flavor name "keyword">and any dates/years]\n\n" "## Complete Rhyme Text\n" "[The full poem/rhyme exactly "keyword">as written, line by line]\n\n" "## Last Line of the Rhyme\n" "[The final line of the poem - clearly identified]\n\n" "## Additional Text\n" "[Any other text visible on the headstone]" ) # Prepare API request payload = { "model": "gpt-4o-0806", "messages": [ { "role": "user", "content": [ { "type": "text", "text": prompt, }, { "type": "image_url", "image_url": { "url": data_url } } ], }, ], "max_tokens": 4096, } # Get API credentials api_key = os.getenv("OPENAI_API_KEY") api_base = os.getenv("OPENAI_BASE_URL") "keyword">if api_key "keyword">and api_base: headers = { "Content-Type": "application/json", "Authorization": f"Bearer {api_key}" } print("Sending headstone screenshot to GPT-4o "keyword">for comprehensive analysis...") "keyword">try: response = requests.post(f"{api_base}/chat/completions", headers=headers, json=payload, timeout=60) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: result = response.json() "keyword">if "choices" "keyword">in result "keyword">and len(result["choices"]) > 0: analysis_output = result["choices"][0]["message"]["content"] print("\n" + "=" * 60) print("GPT-4O HEADSTONE ANALYSIS RESULTS") print("=" * 60 + "\n") print(analysis_output) print("\n" + "=" * 60) # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;economic_crunch_headstone_complete_analysis.txt') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write("ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE - COMPLETE ANALYSIS\n") f.write("Ben & Jerry&#x27;s Flavor Graveyard - Oldest Discontinued Flavor\n") f.write("=" * 70 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Analysis Date: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\n") f.write(f"Screenshot Source: {screenshot_path}\n") f.write(f"Original Image URL: {img_src "keyword">if &#x27;img_src' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">else 'N/A'}\n\n") f.write("EXTRACTED RHYME TEXT AND ANALYSIS:\n") f.write("-" * 50 + "\n") f.write(analysis_output) print(f"\nComplete analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") # Extract the last line specifically print(f"\n=== EXTRACTING FINAL ANSWER: LAST LINE OF RHYME ===\n") last_line_extracted = "keyword">None # Look "keyword">for "Last Line" section "keyword">in the analysis "keyword">if "Last Line" "keyword">in analysis_output "keyword">or "## Last Line" "keyword">in analysis_output: lines = analysis_output.split(&#x27;\n') in_last_line_section = "keyword">False "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: line_stripped = line.strip() "keyword">if "## Last Line" "keyword">in line "keyword">or ("Last Line" "keyword">in line "keyword">and ":" "keyword">in line): in_last_line_section = "keyword">True "keyword">continue "keyword">elif line.startswith("##") "keyword">and in_last_line_section: "keyword">break "keyword">elif in_last_line_section "keyword">and line_stripped "keyword">and "keyword">not line_stripped.startswith(&#x27;['): last_line_extracted = line_stripped "keyword">break # Alternative extraction: look "keyword">for the last line "keyword">in the rhyme section "keyword">if "keyword">not last_line_extracted: print("Trying alternative extraction method...") # Find the rhyme section "keyword">and get its last line "keyword">if "## Complete Rhyme Text" "keyword">in analysis_output "keyword">or "Complete Rhyme" "keyword">in analysis_output: lines = analysis_output.split(&#x27;\n') in_rhyme_section = "keyword">False rhyme_lines = [] "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: line_stripped = line.strip() "keyword">if "## Complete Rhyme" "keyword">in line "keyword">or "Complete Rhyme" "keyword">in line: in_rhyme_section = "keyword">True "keyword">continue "keyword">elif line.startswith("##") "keyword">and in_rhyme_section: "keyword">break "keyword">elif in_rhyme_section "keyword">and line_stripped "keyword">and "keyword">not line_stripped.startswith(&#x27;['): rhyme_lines.append(line_stripped) "keyword">if rhyme_lines: last_line_extracted = rhyme_lines[-1] # Get the last line of the rhyme print(f"Extracted last line "keyword">from rhyme section: {last_line_extracted}") "keyword">if last_line_extracted: print(f"\n*** FINAL ANSWER - LAST LINE OF ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE RHYME: ***") print(f&#x27;\n"{last_line_extracted}"\n') # Save the final result final_result = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;plan_objective': 'Find the last line of rhyme text "keyword">from Ben & Jerry\'s oldest discontinued flavor headstone', &#x27;oldest_flavor_identified': 'Economic Crunch', &#x27;flavor_year': '1987', &#x27;headstone_screenshot_path': screenshot_path, &#x27;original_image_url': img_src "keyword">if 'img_src' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">else 'N/A', &#x27;complete_gpt4_analysis': analysis_output, &#x27;last_line_of_rhyme': last_line_extracted, &#x27;plan_status': 'SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED', &#x27;extraction_method': 'Selenium screenshot + GPT-4o Vision analysis' } result_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerry_graveyard_FINAL_ANSWER.json') "keyword">with open(result_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_result, f, indent=2) print(f"Final answer saved to: {result_file}") print(f"\n" + "=" * 70) print("PLAN OBJECTIVE SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED") print("=" * 70) print(f"‚úì Located Ben & Jerry&#x27;s official flavor graveyard website") print(f"‚úì Identified Economic Crunch (1987) "keyword">as the oldest discontinued flavor") print(f"‚úì Successfully captured headstone screenshot using Selenium") print(f"‚úì Extracted complete rhyme text using GPT-4o Vision analysis") print(f"‚úì Identified the last line of the headstone rhyme") print(f"\nFINAL ANSWER: \"{last_line_extracted}\"") print("=" * 70) "keyword">else: print("\n‚ö†Ô∏è Could "keyword">not automatically extract the last line.") print("The complete analysis "keyword">is available "keyword">in the saved file "keyword">for manual review.") print("Please check the analysis file to manually identify the last line.") "keyword">else: print(f"Invalid API response format: {result}") "keyword">else: print(f"GPT-4o API request failed: {response.status_code}") print(f"Response: {response.text}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as api_error: print(f"GPT-4o API request error: {api_error}") "keyword">else: print("Missing OpenAI API credentials (OPENAI_API_KEY "keyword">and OPENAI_BASE_URL)") print("Cannot proceed "keyword">with headstone analysis.") "keyword">else: print(f"Screenshot file "keyword">not found: {screenshot_path}") print("Cannot proceed "keyword">with analysis.") "keyword">else: print("\n‚ùå Economic Crunch headstone "keyword">not found on the page") print("Taking full page screenshot "keyword">for manual review...") full_page_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;graveyard_full_page.png') driver.save_screenshot(full_page_path) print(f"Full page screenshot saved to: {full_page_path}") # Also save page source "keyword">for analysis page_source_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;graveyard_page_source_detailed.html') "keyword">with open(page_source_path, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(driver.page_source) print(f"Page source saved to: {page_source_path}") driver.quit() "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as selenium_error: print(f"Selenium error: {selenium_error}") "keyword">if &#x27;driver' "keyword">in locals(): "keyword">try: driver.quit() "keyword">except: "keyword">pass print(f"\n=== SELENIUM SCREENSHOT ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\n")
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === SELENIUM SCREENSHOT APPROACH FOR HEADSTONE RHYME EXTRACTION === Strategy: Use Selenium to screenshot headstone images directly from webpage Target: Economic Crunch (1987) - oldest discontinued flavor headstone rhyme === STEP 1: SELENIUM HEADSTONE SCREENSHOT CAPTURE === Initializing Chrome WebDriver for screenshot capture... Navigating to: https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/flavor-graveyard Page loaded: Flavor Graveyard | Ben & Jerry‚Äôs Current URL: https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/flavor-graveyard Searching for Economic Crunch headstone image... ‚úì Found Economic Crunch headstone by alt text === CAPTURING HEADSTONE SCREENSHOT === Headstone image source: https://www.benjerry.com/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0042_graveyard_economic_crunch.jpg Headstone alt text: Economic Crunch tombstone Element screenshot failed, trying full page screenshot... [WORKSPACE] Using task-specific workspace: workspace_42d4198c-5895-4f0a-b0c0-424a66465d83 ============================================================ GPT-4O HEADSTONE ANALYSIS RESULTS ============================================================ I'm unable to analyze images directly. However, I can help with text descriptions or provide information about Ben & Jerry's Flavor Graveyard. If you can describe the content or provide the text, I'd be happy to help you organize and format it! ============================================================ Complete analysis saved to: workspace_624cbf11-6a41-4692-af9c-36b3e5ca3130/economic_crunch_headstone_complete_analysis.txt === EXTRACTING FINAL ANSWER: LAST LINE OF RHYME === Trying alternative extraction method... ‚ö†Ô∏è Could not automatically extract the last line. The complete analysis is available in the saved file for manual review. Please check the analysis file to manually identify the last line. === SELENIUM SCREENSHOT ANALYSIS COMPLETE === result = {'created': 1755099673, 'usage': {'completion_tokens': 49, 'prompt_tokens': 1723, 'completion_tokens_details': {'accepted_prediction_tokens': 0, 'audio_tokens': 0, 'reasoning_tokens': 0, 'rejected_prediction_tokens': 0}, 'prompt_tokens_details': {'audio_tokens': 0, 'cached_tokens': 0}, 'total_tokens': 1772}, 'model': 'gpt-4o-2024-08-06', 'id': 'chatcmpl-C47tBUfYVP0FNNtaiA1KA1dQrJlH1', 'choices': [{'finish_reason': 'stop', 'index': 0, 'message': {'role': 'assistant', 'refusal': None, 'annotations': [], 'content': "I'm unable to analyze images directly. However, I can help with text descriptions or provide information about Ben & Jerry's Flavor Graveyard. If you can describe the content or provide the text, I'd be happy to help you organize and format it!"}, 'logprobs': None}], 'system_fingerprint': 'fp_ee1d74bde0', 'object': 'chat.completion'}
tester Code Testing
2025-08-13 23:41:25

Execution partially successful - Code ran without errors and made significant progress by successfully using Selenium to access the Ben & Jerry's graveyard page and locate the Economic Crunch headstone image. However, the GPT-4o Vision analysis failed because the API returned 'I'm unable to analyze images directly' instead of performing the expected image analysis. This prevented extraction of the rhyme text from the headstone screenshot. **PLAN** alignment: 85% - successfully found the graveyard page, identified Economic Crunch (1987) as the oldest flavor, captured the headstone screenshot using Selenium, but failed at the final critical step of extracting the rhyme text due to the Vision API issue. The code structure and approach are sound, but the API response suggests either a configuration problem or the model refusing to process the image. Next steps: (1) Verify the GPT-4o Vision API configuration and credentials, (2) Try alternative image analysis approaches, (3) Check if the screenshot file was properly captured and is accessible, or (4) Try manual review of the saved screenshot file to extract the rhyme text. The selenium screenshot approach has proven effective for bypassing website restrictions and should be the foundation for completing the objective.

üìù Code Python
"keyword">from selenium "keyword">import webdriver "keyword">from selenium.webdriver.common.by "keyword">import By "keyword">from selenium.webdriver.support.ui "keyword">import WebDriverWait "keyword">from selenium.webdriver.support "keyword">import expected_conditions "keyword">as EC "keyword">from selenium.webdriver.chrome.options "keyword">import Options "keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import time "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import base64 "keyword">from dotenv "keyword">import load_dotenv "keyword">import requests "keyword">from PIL "keyword">import Image load_dotenv() print("=== SELENIUM SCREENSHOT APPROACH FOR HEADSTONE RHYME EXTRACTION ===") print("Strategy: Use Selenium to screenshot headstone images directly "keyword">from webpage") print("Target: Economic Crunch (1987) - oldest discontinued flavor headstone rhyme\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # STEP 1: Use Selenium to navigate to graveyard "keyword">and screenshot Economic Crunch headstone print("=== STEP 1: SELENIUM HEADSTONE SCREENSHOT CAPTURE ===\n") "keyword">try: # Set up Chrome options chrome_options = Options() chrome_options.add_argument(&#x27;--headless') chrome_options.add_argument(&#x27;--no-sandbox') chrome_options.add_argument(&#x27;--disable-dev-shm-usage') chrome_options.add_argument(&#x27;--disable-gpu') chrome_options.add_argument(&#x27;--window-size=1920,1080') chrome_options.add_argument(&#x27;--user-agent=Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36') print("Initializing Chrome WebDriver "keyword">for screenshot capture...") driver = webdriver.Chrome(options=chrome_options) # Navigate to the graveyard page graveyard_url = "https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/flavor-graveyard" print(f"Navigating to: {graveyard_url}") driver.get(graveyard_url) time.sleep(5) # Wait "keyword">for page to load print(f"Page loaded: {driver.title}") print(f"Current URL: {driver.current_url}") # Look "keyword">for Economic Crunch headstone image print("\nSearching "keyword">for Economic Crunch headstone image...") # Try multiple strategies to find the Economic Crunch headstone headstone_found = "keyword">False headstone_element = "keyword">None # Strategy 1: Look "keyword">for image "keyword">with Economic Crunch "keyword">in alt text "keyword">try: headstone_element = driver.find_element(By.XPATH, "//img[contains(@alt, &#x27;Economic Crunch')]") print("‚úì Found Economic Crunch headstone by alt text") headstone_found = "keyword">True "keyword">except: print("Strategy 1 failed: No image found "keyword">with Economic Crunch alt text") # Strategy 2: Look "keyword">for image "keyword">with economic_crunch "keyword">in src "keyword">if "keyword">not headstone_found: "keyword">try: headstone_element = driver.find_element(By.XPATH, "//img[contains(@src, &#x27;economic_crunch')]") print("‚úì Found Economic Crunch headstone by src filename") headstone_found = "keyword">True "keyword">except: print("Strategy 2 failed: No image found "keyword">with economic_crunch "keyword">in src") # Strategy 3: Look "keyword">for text containing Economic Crunch "keyword">and find nearby image "keyword">if "keyword">not headstone_found: "keyword">try: # Find text element containing "Economic Crunch" text_element = driver.find_element(By.XPATH, "//*[contains(text(), &#x27;Economic Crunch')]") print("‚úì Found Economic Crunch text element") # Look "keyword">for image "keyword">in the same parent "keyword">or nearby parent = text_element.find_element(By.XPATH, "./ancestor::*[1]") headstone_element = parent.find_element(By.TAG_NAME, "img") print("‚úì Found Economic Crunch headstone near text element") headstone_found = "keyword">True "keyword">except: print("Strategy 3 failed: Could "keyword">not find image near Economic Crunch text") # Strategy 4: Look "keyword">for all graveyard images "keyword">and identify Economic Crunch "keyword">if "keyword">not headstone_found: "keyword">try: # Find all images that might be headstones all_images = driver.find_elements(By.XPATH, "//img[contains(@src, &#x27;tombstone') "keyword">or contains(@src, 'graveyard') "keyword">or contains(@alt, 'tombstone')]") print(f"Found {len(all_images)} potential headstone images") "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(all_images): src = img.get_attribute(&#x27;src') "keyword">or '' alt = img.get_attribute(&#x27;alt') "keyword">or '' print(f" Image {i+1}: src={src[:100]}..., alt={alt}") "keyword">if &#x27;economic_crunch' "keyword">in src.lower() "keyword">or 'economic crunch' "keyword">in alt.lower(): headstone_element = img print(f"‚úì Found Economic Crunch headstone (Image {i+1})") headstone_found = "keyword">True "keyword">break "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"Strategy 4 failed: {e}") "keyword">if headstone_found "keyword">and headstone_element: print("\n=== CAPTURING HEADSTONE SCREENSHOT ===\n") # Get image details img_src = headstone_element.get_attribute(&#x27;src') img_alt = headstone_element.get_attribute(&#x27;alt') print(f"Headstone image source: {img_src}") print(f"Headstone alt text: {img_alt}") # Scroll to the image to ensure it's visible driver.execute_script("arguments[0].scrollIntoView(true);", headstone_element) time.sleep(2) # Take screenshot of the specific element screenshot_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;economic_crunch_headstone_screenshot.png') "keyword">try: # Method 1: Element screenshot (preferred) headstone_element.screenshot(screenshot_path) print(f"‚úì Element screenshot saved to: {screenshot_path}") "keyword">except: # Method 2: Full page screenshot then crop (fallback) print("Element screenshot failed, trying full page screenshot...") full_screenshot_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;full_page_screenshot.png') driver.save_screenshot(full_screenshot_path) # Get element location "keyword">and size "keyword">for cropping location = headstone_element.location size = headstone_element.size print(f"Element location: {location}") print(f"Element size: {size}") # Crop the full screenshot to get just the headstone "keyword">try: "keyword">with Image.open(full_screenshot_path) "keyword">as img: left = location[&#x27;x'] top = location[&#x27;y'] right = left + size[&#x27;width'] bottom = top + size[&#x27;height'] cropped = img.crop((left, top, right, bottom)) cropped.save(screenshot_path) print(f"‚úì Cropped screenshot saved to: {screenshot_path}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as crop_error: print(f"Cropping failed: {crop_error}") # Use full screenshot "keyword">as fallback screenshot_path = full_screenshot_path print(f"Using full page screenshot: {screenshot_path}") # Verify screenshot file "keyword">if os.path.exists(screenshot_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(screenshot_path) print(f"Screenshot file size: {file_size:,} bytes") # Verify it's a valid image "keyword">try: "keyword">with Image.open(screenshot_path) "keyword">as img: print(f"Screenshot dimensions: {img.size[0]} x {img.size[1]} pixels") print(f"Screenshot format: {img.format}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as verify_error: print(f"Screenshot verification error: {verify_error}") # STEP 2: Analyze screenshot "keyword">with GPT-4o Vision print(f"\n=== STEP 2: GPT-4O VISION ANALYSIS OF HEADSTONE SCREENSHOT ===\n") "keyword">if os.path.exists(screenshot_path): print(f"Analyzing screenshot: {screenshot_path}") # Encode screenshot to base64 "keyword">with open(screenshot_path, "rb") "keyword">as f: img_base64 = base64.b64encode(f.read()).decode("utf-8") # Determine image format "keyword">for data URL img_format = "png" "keyword">if screenshot_path.endswith(&#x27;.png') "keyword">else "jpeg" data_url = f"data:image/{img_format};base64,{img_base64}" # Create comprehensive prompt "keyword">for rhyme extraction prompt = ( "This "keyword">is a screenshot of a Ben & Jerry&#x27;s flavor graveyard headstone "keyword">for Economic Crunch, which "keyword">is the oldest discontinued Ben & Jerry's flavor (1987). " "Please analyze this headstone image very carefully "keyword">and extract ALL visible text, "keyword">with special focus on:\n\n" "1. **Flavor Name Confirmation**: Verify this "keyword">is indeed Economic Crunch\n" "2. **Complete Rhyme/Poem Text**: Extract the ENTIRE rhyme "keyword">or poem written on the headstone - this "keyword">is the most critical part\n" "3. **Last Line Identification**: Clearly identify which line "keyword">is the FINAL/LAST line of the rhyme\n" "4. **All Other Text**: Any dates, additional text, "keyword">or inscriptions\n\n" "IMPORTANT: Please transcribe the rhyme text EXACTLY "keyword">as it appears, preserving:\n" "- Every word "keyword">and punctuation mark\n" "- Line breaks "keyword">and verse structure\n" "- Capitalization "keyword">as shown\n\n" "The rhyme/poem "keyword">is the main content we need - please be very thorough "keyword">in extracting every line.\n\n" "Format your response clearly "keyword">as:\n" "## Headstone Identification\n" "[Flavor name "keyword">and any dates/years]\n\n" "## Complete Rhyme Text\n" "[The full poem/rhyme exactly "keyword">as written, line by line]\n\n" "## Last Line of the Rhyme\n" "[The final line of the poem - clearly identified]\n\n" "## Additional Text\n" "[Any other text visible on the headstone]" ) # Prepare API request payload = { "model": "gpt-4o-0806", "messages": [ { "role": "user", "content": [ { "type": "text", "text": prompt, }, { "type": "image_url", "image_url": { "url": data_url } } ], }, ], "max_tokens": 4096, } # Get API credentials api_key = os.getenv("OPENAI_API_KEY") api_base = os.getenv("OPENAI_BASE_URL") "keyword">if api_key "keyword">and api_base: headers = { "Content-Type": "application/json", "Authorization": f"Bearer {api_key}" } print("Sending headstone screenshot to GPT-4o "keyword">for comprehensive analysis...") "keyword">try: response = requests.post(f"{api_base}/chat/completions", headers=headers, json=payload, timeout=60) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: result = response.json() "keyword">if "choices" "keyword">in result "keyword">and len(result["choices"]) > 0: analysis_output = result["choices"][0]["message"]["content"] print("\n" + "=" * 60) print("GPT-4O HEADSTONE ANALYSIS RESULTS") print("=" * 60 + "\n") print(analysis_output) print("\n" + "=" * 60) # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;economic_crunch_headstone_complete_analysis.txt') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write("ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE - COMPLETE ANALYSIS\n") f.write("Ben & Jerry&#x27;s Flavor Graveyard - Oldest Discontinued Flavor\n") f.write("=" * 70 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Analysis Date: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\n") f.write(f"Screenshot Source: {screenshot_path}\n") f.write(f"Original Image URL: {img_src "keyword">if &#x27;img_src' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">else 'N/A'}\n\n") f.write("EXTRACTED RHYME TEXT AND ANALYSIS:\n") f.write("-" * 50 + "\n") f.write(analysis_output) print(f"\nComplete analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") # Extract the last line specifically print(f"\n=== EXTRACTING FINAL ANSWER: LAST LINE OF RHYME ===\n") last_line_extracted = "keyword">None # Look "keyword">for "Last Line" section "keyword">in the analysis "keyword">if "Last Line" "keyword">in analysis_output "keyword">or "## Last Line" "keyword">in analysis_output: lines = analysis_output.split(&#x27;\n') in_last_line_section = "keyword">False "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: line_stripped = line.strip() "keyword">if "## Last Line" "keyword">in line "keyword">or ("Last Line" "keyword">in line "keyword">and ":" "keyword">in line): in_last_line_section = "keyword">True "keyword">continue "keyword">elif line.startswith("##") "keyword">and in_last_line_section: "keyword">break "keyword">elif in_last_line_section "keyword">and line_stripped "keyword">and "keyword">not line_stripped.startswith(&#x27;['): last_line_extracted = line_stripped "keyword">break # Alternative extraction: look "keyword">for the last line "keyword">in the rhyme section "keyword">if "keyword">not last_line_extracted: print("Trying alternative extraction method...") # Find the rhyme section "keyword">and get its last line "keyword">if "## Complete Rhyme Text" "keyword">in analysis_output "keyword">or "Complete Rhyme" "keyword">in analysis_output: lines = analysis_output.split(&#x27;\n') in_rhyme_section = "keyword">False rhyme_lines = [] "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: line_stripped = line.strip() "keyword">if "## Complete Rhyme" "keyword">in line "keyword">or "Complete Rhyme" "keyword">in line: in_rhyme_section = "keyword">True "keyword">continue "keyword">elif line.startswith("##") "keyword">and in_rhyme_section: "keyword">break "keyword">elif in_rhyme_section "keyword">and line_stripped "keyword">and "keyword">not line_stripped.startswith(&#x27;['): rhyme_lines.append(line_stripped) "keyword">if rhyme_lines: last_line_extracted = rhyme_lines[-1] # Get the last line of the rhyme print(f"Extracted last line "keyword">from rhyme section: {last_line_extracted}") "keyword">if last_line_extracted: print(f"\n*** FINAL ANSWER - LAST LINE OF ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE RHYME: ***") print(f&#x27;\n"{last_line_extracted}"\n') # Save the final result final_result = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;plan_objective': 'Find the last line of rhyme text "keyword">from Ben & Jerry\'s oldest discontinued flavor headstone', &#x27;oldest_flavor_identified': 'Economic Crunch', &#x27;flavor_year': '1987', &#x27;headstone_screenshot_path': screenshot_path, &#x27;original_image_url': img_src "keyword">if 'img_src' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">else 'N/A', &#x27;complete_gpt4_analysis': analysis_output, &#x27;last_line_of_rhyme': last_line_extracted, &#x27;plan_status': 'SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED', &#x27;extraction_method': 'Selenium screenshot + GPT-4o Vision analysis' } result_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;ben_jerry_graveyard_FINAL_ANSWER.json') "keyword">with open(result_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_result, f, indent=2) print(f"Final answer saved to: {result_file}") print(f"\n" + "=" * 70) print("PLAN OBJECTIVE SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED") print("=" * 70) print(f"‚úì Located Ben & Jerry&#x27;s official flavor graveyard website") print(f"‚úì Identified Economic Crunch (1987) "keyword">as the oldest discontinued flavor") print(f"‚úì Successfully captured headstone screenshot using Selenium") print(f"‚úì Extracted complete rhyme text using GPT-4o Vision analysis") print(f"‚úì Identified the last line of the headstone rhyme") print(f"\nFINAL ANSWER: \"{last_line_extracted}\"") print("=" * 70) "keyword">else: print("\n‚ö†Ô∏è Could "keyword">not automatically extract the last line.") print("The complete analysis "keyword">is available "keyword">in the saved file "keyword">for manual review.") print("Please check the analysis file to manually identify the last line.") "keyword">else: print(f"Invalid API response format: {result}") "keyword">else: print(f"GPT-4o API request failed: {response.status_code}") print(f"Response: {response.text}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as api_error: print(f"GPT-4o API request error: {api_error}") "keyword">else: print("Missing OpenAI API credentials (OPENAI_API_KEY "keyword">and OPENAI_BASE_URL)") print("Cannot proceed "keyword">with headstone analysis.") "keyword">else: print(f"Screenshot file "keyword">not found: {screenshot_path}") print("Cannot proceed "keyword">with analysis.") "keyword">else: print("\n‚ùå Economic Crunch headstone "keyword">not found on the page") print("Taking full page screenshot "keyword">for manual review...") full_page_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;graveyard_full_page.png') driver.save_screenshot(full_page_path) print(f"Full page screenshot saved to: {full_page_path}") # Also save page source "keyword">for analysis page_source_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;graveyard_page_source_detailed.html') "keyword">with open(page_source_path, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(driver.page_source) print(f"Page source saved to: {page_source_path}") driver.quit() "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as selenium_error: print(f"Selenium error: {selenium_error}") "keyword">if &#x27;driver' "keyword">in locals(): "keyword">try: driver.quit() "keyword">except: "keyword">pass print(f"\n=== SELENIUM SCREENSHOT ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\n")
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === SELENIUM SCREENSHOT APPROACH FOR HEADSTONE RHYME EXTRACTION === Strategy: Use Selenium to screenshot headstone images directly from webpage Target: Economic Crunch (1987) - oldest discontinued flavor headstone rhyme === STEP 1: SELENIUM HEADSTONE SCREENSHOT CAPTURE === Initializing Chrome WebDriver for screenshot capture... Navigating to: https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/flavor-graveyard Page loaded: Flavor Graveyard | Ben & Jerry‚Äôs Current URL: https://www.benjerry.com/flavors/flavor-graveyard Searching for Economic Crunch headstone image... ‚úì Found Economic Crunch headstone by alt text === CAPTURING HEADSTONE SCREENSHOT === Headstone image source: https://www.benjerry.com/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0042_graveyard_economic_crunch.jpg Headstone alt text: Economic Crunch tombstone Element screenshot failed, trying full page screenshot... [WORKSPACE] Using task-specific workspace: workspace_42d4198c-5895-4f0a-b0c0-424a66465d83 ============================================================ GPT-4O HEADSTONE ANALYSIS RESULTS ============================================================ I'm unable to analyze images directly. However, I can help with text descriptions or provide information about Ben & Jerry's Flavor Graveyard. If you can describe the content or provide the text, I'd be happy to help you organize and format it! ============================================================ Complete analysis saved to: workspace_624cbf11-6a41-4692-af9c-36b3e5ca3130/economic_crunch_headstone_complete_analysis.txt === EXTRACTING FINAL ANSWER: LAST LINE OF RHYME === Trying alternative extraction method... ‚ö†Ô∏è Could not automatically extract the last line. The complete analysis is available in the saved file for manual review. Please check the analysis file to manually identify the last line. === SELENIUM SCREENSHOT ANALYSIS COMPLETE === result = {'created': 1755099673, 'usage': {'completion_tokens': 49, 'prompt_tokens': 1723, 'completion_tokens_details': {'accepted_prediction_tokens': 0, 'audio_tokens': 0, 'reasoning_tokens': 0, 'rejected_prediction_tokens': 0}, 'prompt_tokens_details': {'audio_tokens': 0, 'cached_tokens': 0}, 'total_tokens': 1772}, 'model': 'gpt-4o-2024-08-06', 'id': 'chatcmpl-C47tBUfYVP0FNNtaiA1KA1dQrJlH1', 'choices': [{'finish_reason': 'stop', 'index': 0, 'message': {'role': 'assistant', 'refusal': None, 'annotations': [], 'content': "I'm unable to analyze images directly. However, I can help with text descriptions or provide information about Ben & Jerry's Flavor Graveyard. If you can describe the content or provide the text, I'd be happy to help you organize and format it!"}, 'logprobs': None}], 'system_fingerprint': 'fp_ee1d74bde0', 'object': 'chat.completion'}
developer Code Execution - Plan 01 (Iteration 6)
2025-08-13 23:42:46

Code execution result:

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import base64 "keyword">from PIL "keyword">import Image "keyword">import requests "keyword">from dotenv "keyword">import load_dotenv load_dotenv() print("=== ALTERNATIVE IMAGE ANALYSIS FOR ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE ===") print("Strategy: Inspect workspace files "keyword">and "keyword">try alternative OCR/analysis methods") print("Objective: Extract rhyme text "keyword">from Economic Crunch headstone screenshot\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # STEP 1: Inspect workspace files to understand what we have print("=== STEP 1: WORKSPACE FILE INSPECTION ===\n") "keyword">if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): workspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) print(f"Files "keyword">in workspace ({len(workspace_files)} total):") "keyword">for file "keyword">in workspace_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Look "keyword">for screenshot files screenshot_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in workspace_files "keyword">if &#x27;screenshot' "keyword">in f.lower() "keyword">or f.endswith(('.png', '.jpg', '.jpeg'))] print(f"\nScreenshot/image files found: {len(screenshot_files)}") "keyword">for screenshot "keyword">in screenshot_files: screenshot_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, screenshot) print(f"\nAnalyzing: {screenshot}") # Verify image properties "keyword">try: "keyword">with Image.open(screenshot_path) "keyword">as img: print(f" Dimensions: {img.size[0]} x {img.size[1]} pixels") print(f" Format: {img.format}") print(f" Mode: {img.mode}") # If this looks like our headstone screenshot, proceed "keyword">with analysis "keyword">if &#x27;economic_crunch' "keyword">in screenshot.lower() "keyword">or 'headstone' "keyword">in screenshot.lower(): print(f" *** This appears to be the Economic Crunch headstone screenshot ***") target_screenshot = screenshot_path "keyword">break "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as img_error: print(f" Error opening image: {img_error}") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found") # STEP 2: Try alternative OCR approaches "keyword">for text extraction print(f"\n=== STEP 2: ALTERNATIVE OCR TEXT EXTRACTION ===\n") "keyword">if &#x27;target_screenshot' "keyword">in locals(): print(f"Target screenshot: {target_screenshot}") # Method 1: Try Tesseract OCR via pytesseract ("keyword">if available) print("\nMethod 1: Attempting Tesseract OCR...") "keyword">try: "keyword">import pytesseract "keyword">from PIL "keyword">import Image # Open "keyword">and process image "keyword">with Image.open(target_screenshot) "keyword">as img: # Convert to RGB "keyword">if needed "keyword">if img.mode != &#x27;RGB': img = img.convert(&#x27;RGB') # Extract text using Tesseract extracted_text = pytesseract.image_to_string(img) "keyword">if extracted_text.strip(): print(f"‚úì Tesseract OCR extracted text:") print(f"{&#x27;-' * 40}") print(extracted_text) print(f"{&#x27;-' * 40}") # Save OCR results ocr_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;economic_crunch_tesseract_ocr.txt') "keyword">with open(ocr_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"TESSERACT OCR EXTRACTION - ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE\n") f.write(f"Extracted on: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\n") f.write(f"Source image: {target_screenshot}\n") f.write(f"{&#x27;=' * 60}\n\n") f.write(extracted_text) print(f"OCR results saved to: {ocr_file}") "keyword">else: print("No text extracted by Tesseract") "keyword">except ImportError: print("pytesseract "keyword">not available, skipping Tesseract OCR") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as tesseract_error: print(f"Tesseract OCR error: {tesseract_error}") # Method 2: Try online OCR service (OCR.space API) print("\nMethod 2: Attempting online OCR service...") "keyword">try: # OCR.space free API (no key required "keyword">for basic usage) ocr_url = "https://api.ocr.space/parse/image" "keyword">with open(target_screenshot, &#x27;rb') "keyword">as f: files = {&#x27;file': f} data = { &#x27;apikey': 'helloworld', # Free tier key &#x27;language': 'eng', &#x27;isOverlayRequired': "keyword">False, &#x27;detectOrientation': "keyword">True, &#x27;scale': "keyword">True, &#x27;OCREngine': 2 } response = requests.post(ocr_url, files=files, data=data, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: ocr_result = response.json() "keyword">if ocr_result.get(&#x27;IsErroredOnProcessing') == "keyword">False: parsed_text = ocr_result.get(&#x27;ParsedResults', []) "keyword">if parsed_text: extracted_text = parsed_text[0].get(&#x27;ParsedText', '') "keyword">if extracted_text.strip(): print(f"‚úì Online OCR extracted text:") print(f"{&#x27;-' * 40}") print(extracted_text) print(f"{&#x27;-' * 40}") # Save online OCR results online_ocr_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;economic_crunch_online_ocr.txt') "keyword">with open(online_ocr_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"ONLINE OCR EXTRACTION - ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE\n") f.write(f"Extracted on: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\n") f.write(f"Source image: {target_screenshot}\n") f.write(f"OCR Service: OCR.space\n") f.write(f"{&#x27;=' * 60}\n\n") f.write(extracted_text) print(f"Online OCR results saved to: {online_ocr_file}") "keyword">else: print("No text extracted by online OCR") "keyword">else: print("No parsed results "keyword">from online OCR") "keyword">else: print(f"OCR processing error: {ocr_result.get(&#x27;ErrorMessage', 'Unknown error')}") "keyword">else: print(f"Online OCR request failed: {response.status_code}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as online_ocr_error: print(f"Online OCR error: {online_ocr_error}") # Method 3: Try different Vision API approach "keyword">with proper model specification print("\nMethod 3: Attempting corrected GPT-4o Vision API call...") api_key = os.getenv("OPENAI_API_KEY") api_base = os.getenv("OPENAI_BASE_URL") "keyword">if api_key "keyword">and api_base: "keyword">try: # Encode image to base64 "keyword">with open(target_screenshot, "rb") "keyword">as f: img_base64 = base64.b64encode(f.read()).decode("utf-8") # Determine image format img_format = "png" "keyword">if target_screenshot.endswith(&#x27;.png') "keyword">else "jpeg" # Create a more direct prompt prompt = ( "Please read all the text visible "keyword">in this Ben & Jerry&#x27;s flavor graveyard headstone image. " "This "keyword">is "keyword">for Economic Crunch, the oldest discontinued flavor. " "Extract every word you can see, especially any poem "keyword">or rhyme text. " "Format the response "keyword">as:\n\n" "FLAVOR NAME: [name]\n" "ALL VISIBLE TEXT:\n" "[transcribe everything you can read]\n\n" "RHYME/POEM ("keyword">if present):\n" "[the complete poem/rhyme]\n\n" "LAST LINE OF RHYME:\n" "[the final line of any poem/rhyme]" ) # Try "keyword">with a simpler payload structure payload = { "model": "gpt-4o", # Try without the date suffix "messages": [ { "role": "user", "content": [ {"type": "text", "text": prompt}, { "type": "image_url", "image_url": { "url": f"data:image/{img_format};base64,{img_base64}", "detail": "high" } } ] } ], "max_tokens": 1000 } headers = { "Content-Type": "application/json", "Authorization": f"Bearer {api_key}" } print("Sending corrected Vision API request...") response = requests.post(f"{api_base}/chat/completions", headers=headers, json=payload, timeout=60) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: result = response.json() "keyword">if "choices" "keyword">in result "keyword">and len(result["choices"]) > 0: vision_output = result["choices"][0]["message"]["content"] print(f"‚úì GPT-4o Vision analysis successful:") print(f"{&#x27;-' * 50}") print(vision_output) print(f"{&#x27;-' * 50}") # Save Vision API results vision_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;economic_crunch_vision_analysis.txt') "keyword">with open(vision_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"GPT-4O VISION ANALYSIS - ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE\n") f.write(f"Analyzed on: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\n") f.write(f"Source image: {target_screenshot}\n") f.write(f"{&#x27;=' * 60}\n\n") f.write(vision_output) print(f"Vision analysis saved to: {vision_file}") # Try to extract the last line "keyword">from the vision analysis "keyword">if "LAST LINE" "keyword">in vision_output.upper(): lines = vision_output.split(&#x27;\n') "keyword">for i, line "keyword">in enumerate(lines): "keyword">if "LAST LINE" "keyword">in line.upper(): # Get the next non-empty line "keyword">for j "keyword">in range(i+1, len(lines)): next_line = lines[j].strip() "keyword">if next_line "keyword">and "keyword">not next_line.startswith(&#x27;['): print(f"\n*** EXTRACTED LAST LINE: ***") print(f&#x27;\n"{next_line}"\n') # Save final answer final_answer = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;plan_objective': 'Extract last line of rhyme "keyword">from oldest Ben & Jerry\'s flavor headstone', &#x27;oldest_flavor': 'Economic Crunch', &#x27;year_discontinued': '1987', &#x27;extraction_method': 'Selenium screenshot + GPT-4o Vision', &#x27;last_line_of_rhyme': next_line, &#x27;complete_vision_analysis': vision_output, &#x27;status': 'PLAN COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY' } answer_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;FINAL_ANSWER_last_line.json') "keyword">with open(answer_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_answer, f, indent=2) print(f"Final answer saved to: {answer_file}") "keyword">break "keyword">break "keyword">else: print(f"Invalid Vision API response: {result}") "keyword">else: print(f"Vision API request failed: {response.status_code}") print(f"Response: {response.text[:500]}...") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as vision_error: print(f"Vision API error: {vision_error}") "keyword">else: print("Missing OpenAI API credentials") "keyword">else: print("No target screenshot found "keyword">for analysis") # STEP 3: Manual analysis of any extracted text print(f"\n=== STEP 3: ANALYZING ALL EXTRACTED TEXT ===\n") # Look "keyword">for any OCR "keyword">or analysis files "keyword">in workspace text_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if f.endswith(&#x27;.txt') "keyword">and ('ocr' "keyword">in f.lower() "keyword">or 'analysis' "keyword">in f.lower())] "keyword">if text_files: print(f"Found {len(text_files)} text extraction files:") all_extracted_text = [] "keyword">for text_file "keyword">in text_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, text_file) print(f"\nReading: {text_file}") "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(file_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() print(f" Content length: {len(content)} characters") # Look "keyword">for rhyme-like content lines = content.split(&#x27;\n') potential_rhyme_lines = [] "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: line_clean = line.strip() "keyword">if line_clean "keyword">and len(line_clean) > 10 "keyword">and "keyword">not line_clean.startswith((&#x27;=', '-', 'EXTRACTED', 'Source', 'Analyzed')): potential_rhyme_lines.append(line_clean) "keyword">if potential_rhyme_lines: print(f" Potential rhyme lines found: {len(potential_rhyme_lines)}") "keyword">for i, rhyme_line "keyword">in enumerate(potential_rhyme_lines[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f" {i}. {rhyme_line}") all_extracted_text.extend(potential_rhyme_lines) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as read_error: print(f" Error reading file: {read_error}") # If we have extracted text, "keyword">try to identify the last line "keyword">if all_extracted_text: print(f"\n=== IDENTIFYING LAST LINE FROM ALL EXTRACTED TEXT ===\n") print(f"Total extracted lines: {len(all_extracted_text)}") # The last meaningful line "keyword">is likely the last line of the rhyme "keyword">if all_extracted_text: last_line_candidate = all_extracted_text[-1] print(f"\n*** POTENTIAL LAST LINE OF RHYME: ***") print(f&#x27;\n"{last_line_candidate}"\n') # Save this "keyword">as our best guess manual_result = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;extraction_method': 'Manual analysis of OCR results', &#x27;total_lines_extracted': len(all_extracted_text), &#x27;all_extracted_lines': all_extracted_text, &#x27;identified_last_line': last_line_candidate, &#x27;confidence': 'Medium - based on OCR extraction "keyword">and line position analysis' } manual_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;manual_last_line_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(manual_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(manual_result, f, indent=2) print(f"Manual analysis saved to: {manual_file}") "keyword">else: print("No text extraction files found") print(f"\n=== ALTERNATIVE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Multiple text extraction methods attempted to find the rhyme text") print(f"Check workspace files "keyword">for extracted content "keyword">and potential last line candidates")

tester Code Testing
2025-08-13 23:42:46

Execution failed - Code ran without errors but encountered a critical issue preventing PLAN completion. While the Selenium approach successfully accessed the Ben & Jerry's graveyard page and located the Economic Crunch headstone, the GPT-4o Vision API returned 'I'm unable to analyze images directly' instead of performing image analysis. This suggests the Vision API is not properly configured or accessible, preventing extraction of the rhyme text from the headstone screenshot. **PLAN** alignment: 85% - successfully found graveyard page, identified Economic Crunch (1987) as oldest flavor, captured headstone location, but failed at the critical final step of rhyme text extraction. The code found multiple OCR/analysis files in workspace but they contain only metadata, not actual rhyme text. The 'potential last line' extracted was actually an error message, not the headstone rhyme. Next steps: (1) Try alternative OCR methods like pytesseract or online OCR services to extract text from the full_page_screenshot.png file, (2) Manually examine the screenshot files to identify readable text, or (3) Use a different Vision API service. The selenium screenshot capture method is sound and has successfully obtained the visual content needed - the issue is with text extraction from the captured image.

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import base64 "keyword">from PIL "keyword">import Image "keyword">import requests "keyword">from dotenv "keyword">import load_dotenv load_dotenv() print("=== ALTERNATIVE IMAGE ANALYSIS FOR ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE ===") print("Strategy: Inspect workspace files "keyword">and "keyword">try alternative OCR/analysis methods") print("Objective: Extract rhyme text "keyword">from Economic Crunch headstone screenshot\n") # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = &#x27;workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) # STEP 1: Inspect workspace files to understand what we have print("=== STEP 1: WORKSPACE FILE INSPECTION ===\n") "keyword">if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): workspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) print(f"Files "keyword">in workspace ({len(workspace_files)} total):") "keyword">for file "keyword">in workspace_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Look "keyword">for screenshot files screenshot_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in workspace_files "keyword">if &#x27;screenshot' "keyword">in f.lower() "keyword">or f.endswith(('.png', '.jpg', '.jpeg'))] print(f"\nScreenshot/image files found: {len(screenshot_files)}") "keyword">for screenshot "keyword">in screenshot_files: screenshot_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, screenshot) print(f"\nAnalyzing: {screenshot}") # Verify image properties "keyword">try: "keyword">with Image.open(screenshot_path) "keyword">as img: print(f" Dimensions: {img.size[0]} x {img.size[1]} pixels") print(f" Format: {img.format}") print(f" Mode: {img.mode}") # If this looks like our headstone screenshot, proceed "keyword">with analysis "keyword">if &#x27;economic_crunch' "keyword">in screenshot.lower() "keyword">or 'headstone' "keyword">in screenshot.lower(): print(f" *** This appears to be the Economic Crunch headstone screenshot ***") target_screenshot = screenshot_path "keyword">break "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as img_error: print(f" Error opening image: {img_error}") "keyword">else: print("No workspace directory found") # STEP 2: Try alternative OCR approaches "keyword">for text extraction print(f"\n=== STEP 2: ALTERNATIVE OCR TEXT EXTRACTION ===\n") "keyword">if &#x27;target_screenshot' "keyword">in locals(): print(f"Target screenshot: {target_screenshot}") # Method 1: Try Tesseract OCR via pytesseract ("keyword">if available) print("\nMethod 1: Attempting Tesseract OCR...") "keyword">try: "keyword">import pytesseract "keyword">from PIL "keyword">import Image # Open "keyword">and process image "keyword">with Image.open(target_screenshot) "keyword">as img: # Convert to RGB "keyword">if needed "keyword">if img.mode != &#x27;RGB': img = img.convert(&#x27;RGB') # Extract text using Tesseract extracted_text = pytesseract.image_to_string(img) "keyword">if extracted_text.strip(): print(f"‚úì Tesseract OCR extracted text:") print(f"{&#x27;-' * 40}") print(extracted_text) print(f"{&#x27;-' * 40}") # Save OCR results ocr_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;economic_crunch_tesseract_ocr.txt') "keyword">with open(ocr_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"TESSERACT OCR EXTRACTION - ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE\n") f.write(f"Extracted on: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\n") f.write(f"Source image: {target_screenshot}\n") f.write(f"{&#x27;=' * 60}\n\n") f.write(extracted_text) print(f"OCR results saved to: {ocr_file}") "keyword">else: print("No text extracted by Tesseract") "keyword">except ImportError: print("pytesseract "keyword">not available, skipping Tesseract OCR") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as tesseract_error: print(f"Tesseract OCR error: {tesseract_error}") # Method 2: Try online OCR service (OCR.space API) print("\nMethod 2: Attempting online OCR service...") "keyword">try: # OCR.space free API (no key required "keyword">for basic usage) ocr_url = "https://api.ocr.space/parse/image" "keyword">with open(target_screenshot, &#x27;rb') "keyword">as f: files = {&#x27;file': f} data = { &#x27;apikey': 'helloworld', # Free tier key &#x27;language': 'eng', &#x27;isOverlayRequired': "keyword">False, &#x27;detectOrientation': "keyword">True, &#x27;scale': "keyword">True, &#x27;OCREngine': 2 } response = requests.post(ocr_url, files=files, data=data, timeout=30) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: ocr_result = response.json() "keyword">if ocr_result.get(&#x27;IsErroredOnProcessing') == "keyword">False: parsed_text = ocr_result.get(&#x27;ParsedResults', []) "keyword">if parsed_text: extracted_text = parsed_text[0].get(&#x27;ParsedText', '') "keyword">if extracted_text.strip(): print(f"‚úì Online OCR extracted text:") print(f"{&#x27;-' * 40}") print(extracted_text) print(f"{&#x27;-' * 40}") # Save online OCR results online_ocr_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;economic_crunch_online_ocr.txt') "keyword">with open(online_ocr_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"ONLINE OCR EXTRACTION - ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE\n") f.write(f"Extracted on: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\n") f.write(f"Source image: {target_screenshot}\n") f.write(f"OCR Service: OCR.space\n") f.write(f"{&#x27;=' * 60}\n\n") f.write(extracted_text) print(f"Online OCR results saved to: {online_ocr_file}") "keyword">else: print("No text extracted by online OCR") "keyword">else: print("No parsed results "keyword">from online OCR") "keyword">else: print(f"OCR processing error: {ocr_result.get(&#x27;ErrorMessage', 'Unknown error')}") "keyword">else: print(f"Online OCR request failed: {response.status_code}") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as online_ocr_error: print(f"Online OCR error: {online_ocr_error}") # Method 3: Try different Vision API approach "keyword">with proper model specification print("\nMethod 3: Attempting corrected GPT-4o Vision API call...") api_key = os.getenv("OPENAI_API_KEY") api_base = os.getenv("OPENAI_BASE_URL") "keyword">if api_key "keyword">and api_base: "keyword">try: # Encode image to base64 "keyword">with open(target_screenshot, "rb") "keyword">as f: img_base64 = base64.b64encode(f.read()).decode("utf-8") # Determine image format img_format = "png" "keyword">if target_screenshot.endswith(&#x27;.png') "keyword">else "jpeg" # Create a more direct prompt prompt = ( "Please read all the text visible "keyword">in this Ben & Jerry&#x27;s flavor graveyard headstone image. " "This "keyword">is "keyword">for Economic Crunch, the oldest discontinued flavor. " "Extract every word you can see, especially any poem "keyword">or rhyme text. " "Format the response "keyword">as:\n\n" "FLAVOR NAME: [name]\n" "ALL VISIBLE TEXT:\n" "[transcribe everything you can read]\n\n" "RHYME/POEM ("keyword">if present):\n" "[the complete poem/rhyme]\n\n" "LAST LINE OF RHYME:\n" "[the final line of any poem/rhyme]" ) # Try "keyword">with a simpler payload structure payload = { "model": "gpt-4o", # Try without the date suffix "messages": [ { "role": "user", "content": [ {"type": "text", "text": prompt}, { "type": "image_url", "image_url": { "url": f"data:image/{img_format};base64,{img_base64}", "detail": "high" } } ] } ], "max_tokens": 1000 } headers = { "Content-Type": "application/json", "Authorization": f"Bearer {api_key}" } print("Sending corrected Vision API request...") response = requests.post(f"{api_base}/chat/completions", headers=headers, json=payload, timeout=60) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: result = response.json() "keyword">if "choices" "keyword">in result "keyword">and len(result["choices"]) > 0: vision_output = result["choices"][0]["message"]["content"] print(f"‚úì GPT-4o Vision analysis successful:") print(f"{&#x27;-' * 50}") print(vision_output) print(f"{&#x27;-' * 50}") # Save Vision API results vision_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;economic_crunch_vision_analysis.txt') "keyword">with open(vision_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"GPT-4O VISION ANALYSIS - ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE\n") f.write(f"Analyzed on: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\n") f.write(f"Source image: {target_screenshot}\n") f.write(f"{&#x27;=' * 60}\n\n") f.write(vision_output) print(f"Vision analysis saved to: {vision_file}") # Try to extract the last line "keyword">from the vision analysis "keyword">if "LAST LINE" "keyword">in vision_output.upper(): lines = vision_output.split(&#x27;\n') "keyword">for i, line "keyword">in enumerate(lines): "keyword">if "LAST LINE" "keyword">in line.upper(): # Get the next non-empty line "keyword">for j "keyword">in range(i+1, len(lines)): next_line = lines[j].strip() "keyword">if next_line "keyword">and "keyword">not next_line.startswith(&#x27;['): print(f"\n*** EXTRACTED LAST LINE: ***") print(f&#x27;\n"{next_line}"\n') # Save final answer final_answer = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;plan_objective': 'Extract last line of rhyme "keyword">from oldest Ben & Jerry\'s flavor headstone', &#x27;oldest_flavor': 'Economic Crunch', &#x27;year_discontinued': '1987', &#x27;extraction_method': 'Selenium screenshot + GPT-4o Vision', &#x27;last_line_of_rhyme': next_line, &#x27;complete_vision_analysis': vision_output, &#x27;status': 'PLAN COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY' } answer_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;FINAL_ANSWER_last_line.json') "keyword">with open(answer_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_answer, f, indent=2) print(f"Final answer saved to: {answer_file}") "keyword">break "keyword">break "keyword">else: print(f"Invalid Vision API response: {result}") "keyword">else: print(f"Vision API request failed: {response.status_code}") print(f"Response: {response.text[:500]}...") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as vision_error: print(f"Vision API error: {vision_error}") "keyword">else: print("Missing OpenAI API credentials") "keyword">else: print("No target screenshot found "keyword">for analysis") # STEP 3: Manual analysis of any extracted text print(f"\n=== STEP 3: ANALYZING ALL EXTRACTED TEXT ===\n") # Look "keyword">for any OCR "keyword">or analysis files "keyword">in workspace text_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if f.endswith(&#x27;.txt') "keyword">and ('ocr' "keyword">in f.lower() "keyword">or 'analysis' "keyword">in f.lower())] "keyword">if text_files: print(f"Found {len(text_files)} text extraction files:") all_extracted_text = [] "keyword">for text_file "keyword">in text_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, text_file) print(f"\nReading: {text_file}") "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(file_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: content = f.read() print(f" Content length: {len(content)} characters") # Look "keyword">for rhyme-like content lines = content.split(&#x27;\n') potential_rhyme_lines = [] "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: line_clean = line.strip() "keyword">if line_clean "keyword">and len(line_clean) > 10 "keyword">and "keyword">not line_clean.startswith((&#x27;=', '-', 'EXTRACTED', 'Source', 'Analyzed')): potential_rhyme_lines.append(line_clean) "keyword">if potential_rhyme_lines: print(f" Potential rhyme lines found: {len(potential_rhyme_lines)}") "keyword">for i, rhyme_line "keyword">in enumerate(potential_rhyme_lines[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f" {i}. {rhyme_line}") all_extracted_text.extend(potential_rhyme_lines) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as read_error: print(f" Error reading file: {read_error}") # If we have extracted text, "keyword">try to identify the last line "keyword">if all_extracted_text: print(f"\n=== IDENTIFYING LAST LINE FROM ALL EXTRACTED TEXT ===\n") print(f"Total extracted lines: {len(all_extracted_text)}") # Save this "keyword">as our best guess manual_result = { &#x27;analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(), &#x27;extraction_method': 'Manual analysis of OCR results', &#x27;total_lines_extracted': len(all_extracted_text), &#x27;all_extracted_lines': all_extracted_text, &#x27;identified_last_line': last_line_candidate, &#x27;confidence': 'Medium - based on OCR extraction "keyword">and line position analysis' } manual_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;manual_last_line_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(manual_file, &#x27;w') "keyword">as f: json.dump(manual_result, f, indent=2) print(f"Manual analysis saved to: {manual_file}") "keyword">else: print("No text extraction files found") print(f"\n=== ALTERNATIVE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"Multiple text extraction methods attempted to find the rhyme text") print(f"Check workspace files "keyword">for extracted content "keyword">and potential last line candidates")
