{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom PIL import Image, ImageEnhance, ImageFilter\nimport requests\nfrom dotenv import load_dotenv\nimport base64\n\nload_dotenv()\n\nprint("=== MANUAL HEADSTONE LOCATION AND OCR EXTRACTION ===")\nprint("Strategy: Examine full page screenshot, manually locate Economic Crunch headstone area")\nprint("Objective: Extract rhyme text using targeted cropping and multiple OCR methods\\n")\n\n# Ensure workspace directory exists\nworkspace_dir = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\n# STEP 1: Inspect workspace files and locate the full page screenshot\nprint("=== STEP 1: LOCATING FULL PAGE SCREENSHOT ===\\n")\n\nif os.path.exists(workspace_dir):\n workspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir)\n print(f"Workspace files found: {len(workspace_files)}")\n \n screenshot_file = None\n for file in workspace_files:\n if \'screenshot\' in file.lower() and file.endswith(\'.png\'):\n screenshot_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(screenshot_file)\n print(f" - {file}: {file_size:,} bytes")\n \n # Verify it\'s a valid image\n try:\n with Image.open(screenshot_file) as img:\n print(f" Dimensions: {img.size[0]} x {img.size[1]} pixels")\n print(f" Format: {img.format}, Mode: {img.mode}")\n \n # This is likely our target screenshot\n if img.size[0] > 3000: # Large full page screenshot\n target_screenshot = screenshot_file\n print(f" *** Selected as target screenshot ***")\n break\n except Exception as e:\n print(f" Error reading image: {e}")\nelse:\n print("No workspace directory found")\n exit()\n\nif \'target_screenshot\' not in locals():\n print("No suitable screenshot found")\n exit()\n\n# STEP 2: Manually crop the screenshot to focus on headstone areas\nprint(f"\\n=== STEP 2: STRATEGIC CROPPING FOR HEADSTONE CONTENT ===\\n")\n\nprint(f"Processing screenshot: {target_screenshot}")\n\nwith Image.open(target_screenshot) as img:\n width, height = img.size\n print(f"Original image: {width} x {height} pixels")\n \n # Based on typical graveyard webpage layouts, headstones are usually displayed in a grid\n # Let\'s create multiple crops to capture different sections where Economic Crunch might be\n \n crop_regions = [\n # Top section of main content (after header)\n {\n \'name\': \'top_section\',\n \'coords\': (int(width * 0.1), int(height * 0.2), int(width * 0.9), int(height * 0.5)),\n \'description\': \'Top section - likely location for oldest flavors\'\n },\n # Middle section\n {\n \'name\': \'middle_section\', \n \'coords\': (int(width * 0.1), int(height * 0.4), int(width * 0.9), int(height * 0.7)),\n \'description\': \'Middle section - main graveyard content\'\n },\n # Bottom section\n {\n \'name\': \'bottom_section\',\n \'coords\': (int(width * 0.1), int(height * 0.6), int(width * 0.9), int(height * 0.9)),\n \'description\': \'Bottom section - additional headstones\'\n },\n # Left half (in case of side-by-side layout)\n {\n \'name\': \'left_half\',\n \'coords\': (int(width * 0.05), int(height * 0.15), int(width * 0.5), int(height * 0.85)),\n \'description\': \'Left half - potential headstone column\'\n },\n # Right half\n {\n \'name\': \'right_half\',\n \'coords\': (int(width * 0.5), int(height * 0.15), int(width * 0.95), int(height * 0.85)),\n \'description\': \'Right half - potential headstone column\'\n }\n ]\n \n cropped_images = []\n \n for region in crop_regions:\n left, top, right, bottom = region[\'coords\']\n \n # Ensure coordinates are within image bounds\n left = max(0, left)\n top = max(0, top)\n right = min(width, right)\n bottom = min(height, bottom)\n \n print(f"Creating crop: {region[\'name\']} - {region[\'description\']}")\n print(f" Coordinates: ({left}, {top}, {right}, {bottom})")\n \n cropped = img.crop((left, top, right, bottom))\n crop_width, crop_height = cropped.size\n print(f" Crop size: {crop_width} x {crop_height} pixels")\n \n # Save the crop\n crop_filename = f"crop_{region[\'name\']}.png"\n crop_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, crop_filename)\n cropped.save(crop_path)\n \n cropped_images.append({\n \'name\': region[\'name\'],\n \'path\': crop_path,\n \'description\': region[\'description\'],\n \'size\': (crop_width, crop_height)\n })\n \n print(f" Saved: {crop_path}")\n \n print(f"\\nCreated {len(cropped_images)} cropped sections")\n\n# STEP 3: Apply OCR to each cropped section to find Economic Crunch\nprint(f"\\n=== STEP 3: OCR ANALYSIS OF CROPPED SECTIONS ===\\n")\n\nocr_results = []\n\nfor crop_info in cropped_images:\n crop_name = crop_info[\'name\']\n crop_path = crop_info[\'path\']\n \n print(f"\\nAnalyzing {crop_name} ({crop_info[\'description\']})...")\n \n # Enhance the crop for better OCR\n with Image.open(crop_path) as crop_img:\n # Convert to RGB if needed\n if crop_img.mode != \'RGB\':\n crop_img = crop_img.convert(\'RGB\')\n \n # Enhance contrast and sharpness\n enhancer = ImageEnhance.Contrast(crop_img)\n enhanced = enhancer.enhance(1.5)\n \n enhancer = ImageEnhance.Sharpness(enhanced)\n enhanced = enhancer.enhance(1.8)\n \n # Save enhanced version\n enhanced_path = crop_path.replace(\'.png\', \'_enhanced.png\')\n enhanced.save(enhanced_path)\n \n # Create B&W version for OCR\n gray = enhanced.convert(\'L\')\n # Apply threshold\n bw = gray.point(lambda x: 0 if x < 140 else 255, \'1\')\n bw_path = crop_path.replace(\'.png\', \'_bw.png\')\n bw.save(bw_path)\n \n # Try OCR on the enhanced version\n for img_path, img_type in [(enhanced_path, \'Enhanced\'), (bw_path, \'B&W\')]:\n print(f" Trying {img_type} OCR on {crop_name}...")\n \n try:\n # Check file size\n file_size = os.path.getsize(img_path)\n \n if file_size > 1024 * 1024: # 1MB limit for OCR.space\n print(f" File too large ({file_size:,} bytes), compressing...")\n \n with Image.open(img_path) as img:\n # Compress to JPEG\n compressed_path = img_path.replace(\'.png\', \'_compressed.jpg\')\n img.save(compressed_path, \'JPEG\', quality=85, optimize=True)\n img_path = compressed_path\n \n new_size = os.path.getsize(img_path)\n print(f" Compressed to {new_size:,} bytes")\n \n # OCR.space API call\n ocr_url = "https://api.ocr.space/parse/image"\n \n with open(img_path, \'rb\') as f:\n files = {\'file\': f}\n data = {\n \'apikey\': \'helloworld\',\n \'language\': \'eng\',\n \'isOverlayRequired\': False,\n \'detectOrientation\': True,\n \'scale\': True,\n \'OCREngine\': 2\n }\n \n response = requests.post(ocr_url, files=files, data=data, timeout=45)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n ocr_result = response.json()\n \n if not ocr_result.get(\'IsErroredOnProcessing\', True):\n parsed_results = ocr_result.get(\'ParsedResults\', [])\n \n if parsed_results:\n extracted_text = parsed_results[0].get(\'ParsedText\', \'\')\n \n if extracted_text.strip():\n print(f" ‚úì {img_type} OCR extracted {len(extracted_text)} characters")\n \n # Check if this contains Economic Crunch\n if \'economic\' in extracted_text.lower() and \'crunch\' in extracted_text.lower():\n print(f" üéØ FOUND ECONOMIC CRUNCH in {crop_name} {img_type} OCR!")\n \n ocr_results.append({\n \'crop_name\': crop_name,\n \'crop_description\': crop_info[\'description\'],\n \'ocr_type\': img_type,\n \'text\': extracted_text,\n \'length\': len(extracted_text),\n \'contains_economic_crunch\': True\n })\n \n # Save this important result\n result_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f\'economic_crunch_found_{crop_name}_{img_type.lower()}.txt\')\n with open(result_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"ECONOMIC CRUNCH FOUND - {crop_name.upper()} {img_type.upper()} OCR\\n")\n f.write(f"Extracted on: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\\n")\n f.write(f"Source crop: {crop_path}\\n")\n f.write(f"OCR image: {img_path}\\n")\n f.write(f"={\'=\' * 60}\\n\\n")\n f.write(extracted_text)\n \n print(f" Economic Crunch OCR saved to: {result_file}")\n else:\n # Still save for analysis, but note it doesn\'t contain Economic Crunch\n ocr_results.append({\n \'crop_name\': crop_name,\n \'crop_description\': crop_info[\'description\'],\n \'ocr_type\': img_type,\n \'text\': extracted_text,\n \'length\': len(extracted_text),\n \'contains_economic_crunch\': False\n })\n \n print(f" OCR successful but no Economic Crunch found")\n print(f" Preview: {extracted_text[:100]}...")\n else:\n print(f" {img_type} OCR returned empty text")\n else:\n error_msg = ocr_result.get(\'ErrorMessage\', \'Unknown error\')\n print(f" {img_type} OCR processing error: {error_msg}")\n else:\n print(f" {img_type} OCR API failed: {response.status_code}")\n \n except Exception as ocr_error:\n print(f" {img_type} OCR error: {ocr_error}")\n\n# STEP 4: Analyze results and extract rhyme text\nprint(f"\\n=== STEP 4: ANALYZING OCR RESULTS FOR RHYME TEXT ===\\n")\n\n# Find results that contain Economic Crunch\neconomic_crunch_results = [r for r in ocr_results if r.get(\'contains_economic_crunch\', False)]\n\nif economic_crunch_results:\n print(f"üéâ Found {len(economic_crunch_results)} OCR result(s) containing Economic Crunch!")\n \n for i, result in enumerate(economic_crunch_results, 1):\n print(f"\\n{i}. {result[\'crop_name\']} - {result[\'ocr_type\']} OCR")\n print(f" Description: {result[\'crop_description\']}")\n print(f" Text length: {result[\'length\']} characters")\n \n text = result[\'text\']\n lines = [line.strip() for line in text.split(\'\\n\') if line.strip()]\n \n print(f" Extracted lines ({len(lines)} total):")\n for j, line in enumerate(lines, 1):\n print(f" {j:2d}. {line}")\n \n # Look for rhyme structure\n print(f"\\n Analyzing for rhyme content...")\n \n # Find lines that could be part of a rhyme/poem\n rhyme_candidates = []\n \n for line in lines:\n line_lower = line.lower()\n \n # Skip obvious header/title content\n if any(skip in line_lower for skip in [\'economic crunch\', \'discontinued\', \'ben\', \'jerry\', \'flavor\', \'graveyard\']):\n continue\n \n # Look for lines that could be rhyme content\n if (len(line) > 8 and len(line) < 150 and # Reasonable length\n any(char.isalpha() for char in line) and # Contains letters\n line.count(\' \') >= 1): # Has multiple words\n \n rhyme_candidates.append(line)\n \n if rhyme_candidates:\n print(f" üéØ Found {len(rhyme_candidates)} potential rhyme lines:")\n for k, rhyme_line in enumerate(rhyme_candidates, 1):\n print(f" {k}. {rhyme_line}")\n \n # The last line is our target\n last_line = rhyme_candidates[-1]\n \n print(f"\\n *** LAST LINE OF RHYME: ***")\n print(f\' "{last_line}"\')\n \n # Save the final answer\n final_answer = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'plan_objective\': \'Extract the last line of rhyme text from Ben & Jerry\\\'s oldest discontinued flavor headstone\',\n \'oldest_flavor_identified\': \'Economic Crunch\',\n \'year_discontinued\': \'1987\',\n \'extraction_method\': f\'Manual crop analysis + {result["ocr_type"]} OCR from {result["crop_name"]} section\',\n \'source_screenshot\': target_screenshot,\n \'successful_crop_section\': result[\'crop_name\'],\n \'crop_description\': result[\'crop_description\'],\n \'ocr_type_used\': result[\'ocr_type\'],\n \'complete_extracted_text\': text,\n \'all_text_lines\': lines,\n \'identified_rhyme_lines\': rhyme_candidates,\n \'last_line_of_rhyme\': last_line,\n \'plan_status\': \'SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED\',\n \'confidence\': \'High - Successfully found Economic Crunch content via targeted cropping and OCR\'\n }\n \n final_answer_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'FINAL_ANSWER_economic_crunch_rhyme.json\')\n with open(final_answer_file, \'w\') as f:\n json.dump(final_answer, f, indent=2)\n \n print(f"\\n Final answer saved to: {final_answer_file}")\n \n print(f"\\n{\'=\' * 80}")\n print("üèÜ PLAN OBJECTIVE SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED! üèÜ")\n print(f"{\'=\' * 80}")\n print(f"‚úì Located Ben & Jerry\'s official flavor graveyard website")\n print(f"‚úì Identified Economic Crunch (1987) as the oldest discontinued flavor")\n print(f"‚úì Captured full page screenshot of graveyard")\n print(f"‚úì Applied strategic cropping to isolate headstone content")\n print(f"‚úì Used OCR to successfully extract Economic Crunch headstone text")\n print(f"‚úì Identified complete rhyme structure from headstone")\n print(f"‚úì Successfully extracted the last line of the rhyme")\n print(f"\\nüéØ FINAL ANSWER - LAST LINE OF ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE RHYME:")\n print(f\'\\n "{last_line}"\\n\')\n print(f"{\'=\' * 80}")\n \n break # We found our answer, stop here\n \n else:\n print(f" No clear rhyme structure found in this result")\nelse:\n print("‚ùå No OCR results contained Economic Crunch content")\n print("\\nLet\'s examine all OCR results to see what was captured:")\n \n if ocr_results:\n print(f"\\nTotal OCR results: {len(ocr_results)}")\n \n for i, result in enumerate(ocr_results, 1):\n print(f"\\n{i}. {result[\'crop_name\']} - {result[\'ocr_type\']}")\n print(f" Length: {result[\'length\']} characters")\n preview = result[\'text\'][:200] + \'...\' if len(result[\'text\']) > 200 else result[\'text\']\n print(f" Preview: {preview}")\n \n # Save all results for manual review\n result_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f\'ocr_result_{result["crop_name"]}_{result["ocr_type"].lower()}.txt\')\n with open(result_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"OCR RESULT - {result[\'crop_name\'].upper()} {result[\'ocr_type\'].upper()}\\n")\n f.write(f"Extracted on: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\\n")\n f.write(f"{\'=\' * 60}\\n\\n")\n f.write(result[\'text\'])\n \n print(f" Saved to: {result_file}")\n else:\n print("No OCR results obtained from any cropped sections")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== MANUAL HEADSTONE EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===")',
"description": "Comprehensive manual approach to extract the Economic Crunch headstone rhyme by strategically cropping the existing full page screenshot and applying targeted OCR analysis. full_page_screenshot.png: 1,750,082 bytes\n Dimensions: 3840 x 1776 pixels\n Format: PNG, Mode: RGB\n *** Selected as target screenshot ***\n\n=== STEP 2: STRATEGIC CROPPING FOR HEADSTONE CONTENT ===\n\nProcessing screenshot: workspace_624cbf11-6a41-4692-af9c-36b3e5ca3130/full_page_screenshot.png\nOriginal image: 3840 x 1776 pixels\nCreating crop: top_section - likely location for oldest flavors)...\n Trying Enhanced OCR on top_section...\n Retrieved 104 revisions\n Date range: 2016-06-14T19:06:41Z to 2016-07-03T19:03:39Z\n Revisions before April 2018 (this batch): 104\n Revisions after March 2018 (this batch): 0\n Total collected so far: 477\n ‚úÖ Reached end of revision history\n\n‚úÖ Complete revision history extracted!\n\n=== EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===\n\nTotal API requests made: 6\nTotal revisions collected (before April 2018): 477\nRevisions after March 2018 (excluded): 2127\n\n=== PRE-RELEASE REVISION ANALYSIS ===\n\nüìä PRE-RELEASE STATISTICS (Creation to March 2018):\n Total revisions before April 2018 release: 477\n Page creation date: 2016-06-14T19:06:41Z\n Last edit before April release: 2018-03-24T21:46:05Z\n Pre-release editing period: 2016-06-14T19:06:41Z to 2018-03-24T21:46:05Z\n Unique contributors during pre-release: 165\n Average page size during pre-release: 27485 bytes\n Size range: 0 to 52638 bytes\n\nüìÖ PRE-RELEASE EDITING ACTIVITY PATTERNS:\n\nEdits by month (pre-release):\n 2016-06: 99 edits\n 2016-07: 30 edits\n 2016-08: 15 edits\n 2016-09: 11 edits\n 2016-10: 7 edits\n 2016-11: 15 edits\n 2016-12: 8 edits\n 2017-01: 35 edits\n 2017-02: 22 edits\n 2017-03: 7 edits\n 2017-04: 7 edits\n 2017-05: 14 edits\n 2017-06: 36 edits\n 2017-07: 12 edits\n 2017-08: 7 edits\n 2017-09: 4 edits\n 2017-10: 14 edits\n 2017-11: 5 edits\n 2017-12: 23 edits\n 2018-01: 38 edits\n 2018-02: 54 edits\n 2018-03: 14 edits\n\nüë• TOP PRE-RELEASE CONTRIBUTORS:\n 1. {
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom PIL import Image, ImageEnhance, ImageFilter\nimport requests\nfrom dotenv import load_dotenv\nimport base64\n\nload_dotenv()\n\nprint("=== FOCUSED ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE RHYME EXTRACTION ===")\nprint("Strategy: Use existing screenshot with precise cropping and multiple OCR approaches")\nprint("Objective: Extract the complete rhyme text and identify the last line\\n")\n\n# Ensure workspace directory exists\nworkspace_dir = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\n# STEP 1: Locate the full page screenshot from previous attempts\nprint("=== STEP 1: LOCATING EXISTING SCREENSHOT ===\\n")\n\nscreenshot_path = None\nif os.path.exists(workspace_dir):\n for file in os.listdir(workspace_dir):\n if \'screenshot\' in file.lower() and file.endswith(\'.png\'):\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n \n # Check if this is a large full page screenshot\n try:\n with Image.open(file_path) as img:\n if img.size[0] > 3000: # Large screenshot likely from graveyard page\n screenshot_path = file_path\n print(f"Found target screenshot: {file}")\n print(f" Dimensions: {img.size[0]} x {img.size[1]} pixels")\n print(f" File size: {file_size:,} bytes")\n break\n except Exception as e:\n continue\n\nif not screenshot_path:\n print("No suitable screenshot found. Cannot proceed.")\n exit()\n\n# STEP 2: Create targeted crops focusing on headstone areas\nprint(f"\\n=== STEP 2: CREATING TARGETED HEADSTONE CROPS ===\\n")\n\nwith Image.open(screenshot_path) as img:\n width, height = img.size\n print(f"Processing screenshot: {width} x {height} pixels")\n \n # Create focused crops that are more likely to contain individual headstones\n # Based on typical graveyard layouts, headstones are arranged in rows/columns\n \n crop_strategies = [\n # Upper left quadrant - often where featured/oldest items appear\n {\n \'name\': \'upper_left\',\n \'coords\': (int(width * 0.05), int(height * 0.15), int(width * 0.5), int(height * 0.6)),\n \'description\': \'Upper left - prime location for oldest flavors\'\n },\n # Upper right quadrant\n {\n \'name\': \'upper_right\', \n \'coords\': (int(width * 0.5), int(height * 0.15), int(width * 0.95), int(height * 0.6)),\n \'description\': \'Upper right quadrant\'\n },\n # Center strip - main content area\n {\n \'name\': \'center_strip\',\n \'coords\': (int(width * 0.2), int(height * 0.25), int(width * 0.8), int(height * 0.75)),\n \'description\': \'Center strip - main graveyard content\'\n },\n # Top third - header area where featured content often appears\n {\n \'name\': \'top_third\',\n \'coords\': (int(width * 0.1), int(height * 0.1), int(width * 0.9), int(height * 0.45)),\n \'description\': \'Top third - featured content area\'\n }\n ]\n \n created_crops = []\n \n for strategy in crop_strategies:\n left, top, right, bottom = strategy[\'coords\']\n \n # Ensure coordinates are valid\n left = max(0, left)\n top = max(0, top)\n right = min(width, right)\n bottom = min(height, bottom)\n \n if right > left and bottom > top:\n crop_img = img.crop((left, top, right, bottom))\n crop_filename = f"headstone_crop_{strategy[\'name\']}.png"\n crop_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, crop_filename)\n crop_img.save(crop_path)\n \n created_crops.append({\n \'name\': strategy[\'name\'],\n \'path\': crop_path,\n \'description\': strategy[\'description\'],\n \'size\': crop_img.size\n })\n \n print(f"Created crop: {strategy[\'name\']} - {crop_img.size[0]}x{crop_img.size[1]} pixels")\n print(f" Description: {strategy[\'description\']}")\n print(f" Saved to: {crop_path}")\n\nprint(f"\\nCreated {len(created_crops)} targeted crops")\n\n# STEP 3: Enhance each crop for optimal OCR and apply multiple OCR methods\nprint(f"\\n=== STEP 3: MULTI-METHOD OCR ANALYSIS ===\\n")\n\nocr_results = []\n\nfor crop_info in created_crops:\n crop_name = crop_info[\'name\']\n crop_path = crop_info[\'path\']\n \n print(f"\\nProcessing crop: {crop_name}")\n \n with Image.open(crop_path) as crop_img:\n # Ensure RGB mode\n if crop_img.mode != \'RGB\':\n crop_img = crop_img.convert(\'RGB\')\n \n # Create multiple enhanced versions for different OCR approaches\n versions = []\n \n # Version 1: High contrast enhanced\n contrast_enhanced = ImageEnhance.Contrast(crop_img).enhance(2.0)\n sharpness_enhanced = ImageEnhance.Sharpness(contrast_enhanced).enhance(2.5)\n enhanced_path = crop_path.replace(\'.png\', \'_enhanced.png\')\n sharpness_enhanced.save(enhanced_path)\n versions.append((\'Enhanced\', enhanced_path))\n \n # Version 2: Grayscale with threshold\n gray_img = crop_img.convert(\'L\')\n # Apply binary threshold for clear text extraction\n threshold_img = gray_img.point(lambda x: 0 if x < 128 else 255, \'1\')\n threshold_path = crop_path.replace(\'.png\', \'_threshold.png\')\n threshold_img.save(threshold_path)\n versions.append((\'Threshold\', threshold_path))\n \n # Version 3: Brightness and contrast adjusted\n brightness_enhanced = ImageEnhance.Brightness(crop_img).enhance(1.3)\n contrast_enhanced2 = ImageEnhance.Contrast(brightness_enhanced).enhance(1.8)\n bright_path = crop_path.replace(\'.png\', \'_bright.png\')\n contrast_enhanced2.save(bright_path)\n versions.append((\'Bright\', bright_path))\n \n # Apply OCR to each version\n for version_name, version_path in versions:\n print(f" Trying {version_name} OCR...")\n \n try:\n # Check and compress if needed\n file_size = os.path.getsize(version_path)\n ocr_path = version_path\n \n if file_size > 1024 * 1024: # 1MB limit\n print(f" Compressing large file ({file_size:,} bytes)...")\n with Image.open(version_path) as img:\n compressed_path = version_path.replace(\'.png\', \'_compressed.jpg\')\n img.save(compressed_path, \'JPEG\', quality=90, optimize=True)\n ocr_path = compressed_path\n print(f" Compressed to {os.path.getsize(ocr_path):,} bytes")\n \n # OCR.space API call\n with open(ocr_path, \'rb\') as f:\n files = {\'file\': f}\n data = {\n \'apikey\': \'helloworld\',\n \'language\': \'eng\',\n \'isOverlayRequired\': False,\n \'detectOrientation\': True,\n \'scale\': True,\n \'OCREngine\': 2,\n \'isTable\': False\n }\n \n response = requests.post(\'https://api.ocr.space/parse/image\', \n files=files, data=data, timeout=45)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n ocr_result = response.json()\n \n if not ocr_result.get(\'IsErroredOnProcessing\', True):\n parsed_results = ocr_result.get(\'ParsedResults\', [])\n \n if parsed_results and parsed_results[0].get(\'ParsedText\', \'\').strip():\n extracted_text = parsed_results[0][\'ParsedText\']\n text_length = len(extracted_text)\n \n print(f" ‚úì Extracted {text_length} characters")\n \n # Check for Economic Crunch content\n text_lower = extracted_text.lower()\n has_economic = \'economic\' in text_lower\n has_crunch = \'crunch\' in text_lower\n \n if has_economic and has_crunch:\n print(f" üéØ FOUND ECONOMIC CRUNCH CONTENT!")\n \n # Save this important result immediately\n found_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f\'ECONOMIC_CRUNCH_FOUND_{crop_name}_{version_name}.txt\')\n with open(found_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE TEXT FOUND\\n")\n f.write(f"Source: {crop_name} crop, {version_name} enhancement\\n")\n f.write(f"Extracted: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\\n")\n f.write(f"{\'=\'*60}\\n\\n")\n f.write(extracted_text)\n \n print(f" Economic Crunch content saved to: {found_file}")\n \n # Store result for analysis\n ocr_results.append({\n \'crop_name\': crop_name,\n \'version\': version_name,\n \'text\': extracted_text,\n \'length\': text_length,\n \'has_economic_crunch\': has_economic and has_crunch,\n \'source_path\': version_path\n })\n \n # Show preview\n preview = extracted_text[:150] + \'...\' if len(extracted_text) > 150 else extracted_text\n print(f" Preview: {preview}")\n else:\n print(f" No text extracted")\n else:\n error_msg = ocr_result.get(\'ErrorMessage\', \'Unknown error\')\n print(f" OCR error: {error_msg}")\n else:\n print(f" API error: {response.status_code}")\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f" Exception: {e}")\n\n# STEP 4: Analyze all OCR results for Economic Crunch rhyme content\nprint(f"\\n=== STEP 4: ANALYZING OCR RESULTS FOR RHYME TEXT ===\\n")\n\n# Find results containing Economic Crunch\neconomic_crunch_results = [r for r in ocr_results if r.get(\'has_economic_crunch\', False)]\n\nif economic_crunch_results:\n print(f"üéâ Found {len(economic_crunch_results)} result(s) with Economic Crunch content!")\n \n best_result = None\n \n for i, result in enumerate(economic_crunch_results, 1):\n print(f"\\n{i}. {result[\'crop_name\']} - {result[\'version\']} ({result[\'length\']} chars)")\n \n text = result[\'text\']\n lines = [line.strip() for line in text.split(\'\\n\') if line.strip()]\n \n print(f" Text broken into {len(lines)} lines:")\n for j, line in enumerate(lines[:15], 1): # Show first 15 lines\n print(f" {j:2d}. {line}")\n \n # Identify rhyme content by filtering out headers/titles\n rhyme_lines = []\n \n for line in lines:\n line_clean = line.strip()\n line_lower = line_clean.lower()\n \n # Skip obvious non-rhyme content\n skip_terms = [\'economic crunch\', \'discontinued\', \'ben\', \'jerry\', \'flavor\', \'graveyard\', \n \'tombstone\', \'year\', \'date\', \'website\', \'copyright\']\n \n if any(term in line_lower for term in skip_terms):\n continue\n \n # Look for lines that could be part of a poem/rhyme\n if (len(line_clean) > 5 and len(line_clean) < 100 and # Reasonable length\n any(c.isalpha() for c in line_clean) and # Contains letters\n \' \' in line_clean): # Multiple words\n \n rhyme_lines.append(line_clean)\n \n if rhyme_lines:\n print(f"\\n üéØ Identified {len(rhyme_lines)} potential rhyme lines:")\n for k, rhyme_line in enumerate(rhyme_lines, 1):\n print(f" {k}. {rhyme_line}")\n \n # The last line is what we need\n last_line = rhyme_lines[-1]\n \n print(f"\\n *** LAST LINE OF RHYME: ***")\n print(f\' "{last_line}"\')\n \n # This is our best result - save it\n best_result = {\n \'crop_name\': result[\'crop_name\'],\n \'version\': result[\'version\'],\n \'complete_text\': text,\n \'all_lines\': lines,\n \'rhyme_lines\': rhyme_lines,\n \'last_line\': last_line\n }\n \n break # Found rhyme content, use this result\n \n # Save final answer if we found rhyme content\n if best_result:\n final_answer = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'plan_objective\': \'Extract the last line of rhyme text from Ben & Jerry\\\'s oldest discontinued flavor headstone\',\n \'oldest_flavor\': \'Economic Crunch\',\n \'year_discontinued\': \'1987\',\n \'extraction_method\': f\'Screenshot cropping + {best_result["version"]} OCR from {best_result["crop_name"]} section\',\n \'source_screenshot\': screenshot_path,\n \'successful_crop\': best_result[\'crop_name\'],\n \'ocr_version\': best_result[\'version\'],\n \'complete_headstone_text\': best_result[\'complete_text\'],\n \'identified_rhyme_lines\': best_result[\'rhyme_lines\'],\n \'last_line_of_rhyme\': best_result[\'last_line\'],\n \'plan_status\': \'SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED\',\n \'confidence\': \'High - Successfully extracted Economic Crunch headstone rhyme via targeted OCR\'\n }\n \n final_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'BEN_JERRY_ECONOMIC_CRUNCH_FINAL_ANSWER.json\')\n with open(final_file, \'w\') as f:\n json.dump(final_answer, f, indent=2)\n \n print(f"\\n{\'-\'*80}")\n print("üèÜ PLAN OBJECTIVE SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED! üèÜ")\n print(f"{\'-\'*80}")\n print(f"‚úì Located Ben & Jerry\'s official flavor graveyard")\n print(f"‚úì Identified Economic Crunch (1987) as oldest discontinued flavor")\n print(f"‚úì Successfully extracted headstone content via targeted cropping")\n print(f"‚úì Applied multiple OCR methods to extract rhyme text")\n print(f"‚úì Identified complete rhyme structure")\n print(f"‚úì Successfully extracted the last line of the rhyme")\n print(f"\\nüéØ FINAL ANSWER - LAST LINE OF ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE RHYME:")\n print(f\'\\n "{best_result["last_line"]}"\\n\')\n print(f"Final answer saved to: {final_file}")\n print(f"{\'-\'*80}")\n else:\n print(f"\\n‚ö†Ô∏è Found Economic Crunch content but could not identify clear rhyme structure")\nelse:\n print(f"‚ùå No Economic Crunch content found in any OCR results")\n \n if ocr_results:\n print(f"\\nHowever, extracted text from {len(ocr_results)} sources:")\n for result in ocr_results[:5]: # Show first 5 results\n preview = result[\'text\'][:100] + \'...\' if len(result[\'text\']) > 100 else result[\'text\']\n print(f" {result[\'crop_name\']}-{result[\'version\']}: {preview}")\n \n print(f"\\nAll OCR results saved to workspace for manual review if needed")\n else:\n print(f"\\nNo text was successfully extracted from any crop")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== FOCUSED EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===")',
"description": "Final focused approach to extract the Economic Crunch headstone rhyme using the existing full page screenshot with strategic cropping and comprehensive OCR analysis. This code: (1) Locates the existing full page screenshot from previous selenium attempts, (2) Creates 4 strategic crops targeting areas where the oldest flavor headstone would likely appear (upper left quadrant, upper right, center strip, top third), (3) Enhances each crop using 3 different methods (high contrast, binary threshold, brightness adjustment) to optimize for different OCR scenarios, (4) Applies OCR.space API to all enhanced versions, specifically searching for 'Economic Crunch' content, (5) Analyzes successful extractions to identify rhyme structure by filtering out header content and isolating poetic lines, (6) Extracts the last line of the rhyme and saves the complete analysis. This multi-pronged approach maximizes the chances of successfully capturing and extracting the Economic Crunch headstone rhyme text by trying multiple crop areas and enhancement techniques, addressing the previous issues where OCR failed to locate the specific headstone content needed to complete the PLAN objective.",

"code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom PIL import Image, ImageEnhance, ImageFilter\nimport requests\nfrom dotenv import load_dotenv\nimport base64\n\nload_dotenv()\n\nprint("=== ALTERNATIVE OCR APPROACH FOR ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE ===")\nprint("Strategy: Use Microsoft\'s MarkItDown and alternative OCR methods")\nprint("Objective: Extract rhyme text from Economic Crunch headstone using multiple tools\\n")\n\n# Ensure workspace directory exists\nworkspace_dir = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\n# STEP 1: Locate the existing screenshot and examine workspace\nprint("=== STEP 1: WORKSPACE ANALYSIS AND SCREENSHOT LOCATION ===\\n")\n\nif os.path.exists(workspace_dir):\n workspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir)\n print(f"Workspace contains {len(workspace_files)} files:")\n \n screenshot_files = []\n crop_files = []\n \n for file in workspace_files:\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n \n if file.endswith((\'.png\', \'.jpg\', \'.jpeg\')):\n try:\n with Image.open(file_path) as img:\n print(f" üì∑ {file}: {img.size[0]}x{img.size[1]} pixels, {file_size:,} bytes")\n \n if \'screenshot\' in file.lower() and img.size[0] > 3000:\n screenshot_files.append((file_path, img.size, file_size))\n elif \'crop\' in file.lower() or \'headstone\' in file.lower():\n crop_files.append((file_path, img.size, file_size))\n except Exception as e:\n print(f" ‚ùå {file}: Error reading image - {e}")\n else:\n print(f" üìÑ {file}: {file_size:,} bytes")\n \n print(f"\\nFound {len(screenshot_files)} screenshot(s) and {len(crop_files)} crop(s)")\nelse:\n print("No workspace directory found")\n exit()\n\n# Select the best screenshot\ntarget_screenshot = None\nif screenshot_files:\n # Use the largest screenshot (most likely the full page)\n target_screenshot = max(screenshot_files, key=lambda x: x[2])[0] # Sort by file size\n print(f"\\nSelected screenshot: {os.path.basename(target_screenshot)}")\nelse:\n print("No suitable screenshot found")\n exit()\n\n# STEP 2: Try Microsoft MarkItDown for OCR extraction\nprint(f"\\n=== STEP 2: MICROSOFT MARKITDOWN OCR ATTEMPT ===\\n")\n\ntry:\n # Try to import and use markitdown\n import subprocess\n import sys\n \n # Check if markitdown is available, if not try to install it\n try:\n from markitdown import MarkItDown\n print("‚úì MarkItDown already available")\n except ImportError:\n print("Installing MarkItDown...")\n subprocess.check_call([sys.executable, "-m", "pip", "install", "markitdown"])\n from markitdown import MarkItDown\n print("‚úì MarkItDown installed and imported")\n \n # Initialize MarkItDown\n md = MarkItDown()\n \n # Process the screenshot with MarkItDown\n print(f"Processing screenshot with MarkItDown: {target_screenshot}")\n \n try:\n result = md.convert(target_screenshot)\n extracted_text = result.text_content if hasattr(result, \'text_content\') else str(result)\n \n if extracted_text and len(extracted_text.strip()) > 10:\n print(f"‚úì MarkItDown extracted {len(extracted_text)} characters")\n \n # Save MarkItDown results\n markitdown_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'markitdown_extraction.txt\')\n with open(markitdown_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"MARKITDOWN OCR EXTRACTION - BEN & JERRY\'S GRAVEYARD\\n")\n f.write(f"Extracted on: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\\n")\n f.write(f"Source: {target_screenshot}\\n")\n f.write(f"{\'=\'*60}\\n\\n")\n f.write(extracted_text)\n \n print(f"MarkItDown results saved to: {markitdown_file}")\n \n # Check for Economic Crunch content\n text_lower = extracted_text.lower()\n if \'economic\' in text_lower and \'crunch\' in text_lower:\n print(f"üéØ FOUND ECONOMIC CRUNCH in MarkItDown extraction!")\n \n # Analyze for rhyme content\n lines = [line.strip() for line in extracted_text.split(\'\\n\') if line.strip()]\n \n print(f"\\nAnalyzing {len(lines)} lines for Economic Crunch rhyme...")\n \n # Find Economic Crunch section\n economic_section_start = -1\n for i, line in enumerate(lines):\n if \'economic\' in line.lower() and \'crunch\' in line.lower():\n economic_section_start = i\n print(f"Found Economic Crunch at line {i+1}: {line}")\n break\n \n if economic_section_start >= 0:\n # Extract lines around Economic Crunch (likely the rhyme)\n section_lines = lines[economic_section_start:economic_section_start+10] # Get next 10 lines\n \n print(f"\\nEconomic Crunch section:")\n for j, section_line in enumerate(section_lines, 1):\n print(f" {j:2d}. {section_line}")\n \n # Filter for rhyme lines (skip title/header)\n rhyme_candidates = []\n for line in section_lines[1:]: # Skip the title line\n line_clean = line.strip()\n line_lower = line_clean.lower()\n \n # Skip obvious non-rhyme content\n if any(skip in line_lower for skip in [\'discontinued\', \'flavor\', \'ben\', \'jerry\', \'year\', \'date\']):\n continue\n \n # Look for potential rhyme lines\n if (len(line_clean) > 5 and len(line_clean) < 120 and\n any(c.isalpha() for c in line_clean) and\n \' \' in line_clean):\n rhyme_candidates.append(line_clean)\n \n if rhyme_candidates:\n print(f"\\nüéØ Identified {len(rhyme_candidates)} potential rhyme lines:")\n for k, rhyme_line in enumerate(rhyme_candidates, 1):\n print(f" {k}. {rhyme_line}")\n \n # The last line is our target\n last_line = rhyme_candidates[-1]\n \n print(f"\\n*** LAST LINE OF ECONOMIC CRUNCH RHYME: ***")\n print(f\'\\n"{last_line}"\\n\')\n \n # Save final answer\n final_answer = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'plan_objective\': \'Extract the last line of rhyme text from Ben & Jerry\\\'s oldest discontinued flavor headstone\',\n \'oldest_flavor\': \'Economic Crunch\',\n \'year_discontinued\': \'1987\',\n \'extraction_method\': \'Microsoft MarkItDown OCR from full page screenshot\',\n \'source_screenshot\': target_screenshot,\n \'complete_extracted_text\': extracted_text,\n \'economic_crunch_section\': section_lines,\n \'identified_rhyme_lines\': rhyme_candidates,\n \'last_line_of_rhyme\': last_line,\n \'plan_status\': \'SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED\',\n \'confidence\': \'High - MarkItDown successfully extracted Economic Crunch headstone content\'\n }\n \n final_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ECONOMIC_CRUNCH_MARKITDOWN_FINAL.json\')\n with open(final_file, \'w\') as f:\n json.dump(final_answer, f, indent=2)\n \n print(f"Final answer saved to: {final_file}")\n \n print(f"\\n{\'=\'*80}")\n print("üèÜ PLAN OBJECTIVE SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED! üèÜ")\n print(f"{\'=\'*80}")\n print(f"‚úì Located Ben & Jerry\'s official flavor graveyard")\n print(f"‚úì Identified Economic Crunch (1987) as oldest discontinued flavor")\n print(f"‚úì Successfully extracted headstone content via MarkItDown OCR")\n print(f"‚úì Identified complete rhyme structure")\n print(f"‚úì Successfully extracted the last line of the rhyme")\n print(f"\\nüéØ FINAL ANSWER - LAST LINE OF ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE RHYME:")\n print(f\'\\n "{last_line}"\\n\')\n print(f"{\'=\'*80}")\n \n # Mission accomplished, exit successfully\n exit()\n else:\n print(f"No Economic Crunch content found in MarkItDown extraction")\n preview = extracted_text[:300] + \'...\' if len(extracted_text) > 300 else extracted_text\n print(f"Preview of extracted text: {preview}")\n else:\n print(f"MarkItDown returned minimal or no text")\n \n except Exception as md_error:\n print(f"MarkItDown processing error: {md_error}")\n \nexcept Exception as markitdown_error:\n print(f"MarkItDown setup error: {markitdown_error}")\n\n# STEP 3: Try pytesseract as fallback\nprint(f"\\n=== STEP 3: PYTESSERACT OCR FALLBACK ===\\n")\n\ntry:\n # Try to import pytesseract\n import pytesseract\n print("‚úì pytesseract available")\n \n # Process the screenshot with pytesseract\n print(f"Processing screenshot with pytesseract...")\n \n with Image.open(target_screenshot) as img:\n # Convert to RGB if needed\n if img.mode != \'RGB\':\n img = img.convert(\'RGB\')\n \n # Extract text using pytesseract\n extracted_text = pytesseract.image_to_string(img)\n \n if extracted_text and len(extracted_text.strip()) > 10:\n print(f"‚úì pytesseract extracted {len(extracted_text)} characters")\n \n # Save pytesseract results\n tesseract_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'pytesseract_extraction.txt\')\n with open(tesseract_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"PYTESSERACT OCR EXTRACTION - BEN & JERRY\'S GRAVEYARD\\n")\n f.write(f"Extracted on: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\\n")\n f.write(f"Source: {target_screenshot}\\n")\n f.write(f"{\'=\'*60}\\n\\n")\n f.write(extracted_text)\n \n print(f"pytesseract results saved to: {tesseract_file}")\n \n # Check for Economic Crunch content\n text_lower = extracted_text.lower()\n if \'economic\' in text_lower and \'crunch\' in text_lower:\n print(f"üéØ FOUND ECONOMIC CRUNCH in pytesseract extraction!")\n \n # Similar analysis as above...\n lines = [line.strip() for line in extracted_text.split(\'\\n\') if line.strip()]\n \n # Find Economic Crunch and extract rhyme\n for i, line in enumerate(lines):\n if \'economic\' in line.lower() and \'crunch\' in line.lower():\n print(f"Found Economic Crunch: {line}")\n \n # Get surrounding lines for rhyme content\n context_lines = lines[max(0, i-2):i+8] # Get context around Economic Crunch\n \n rhyme_lines = []\n for context_line in context_lines[1:]: # Skip title\n if (len(context_line) > 5 and len(context_line) < 100 and\n any(c.isalpha() for c in context_line) and\n not any(skip in context_line.lower() for skip in [\'discontinued\', \'ben\', \'jerry\'])):\n rhyme_lines.append(context_line)\n \n if rhyme_lines:\n last_line = rhyme_lines[-1]\n print(f"\\n*** PYTESSERACT FOUND LAST LINE: ***")\n print(f\'"{last_line}"\')\n break\n else:\n print(f"No Economic Crunch found in pytesseract extraction")\n preview = extracted_text[:200] + \'...\' if len(extracted_text) > 200 else extracted_text\n print(f"Preview: {preview}")\n else:\n print(f"pytesseract returned minimal text")\n \nexcept ImportError:\n print("pytesseract not available, skipping...")\nexcept Exception as tesseract_error:\n print(f"pytesseract error: {tesseract_error}")\n\n# STEP 4: Try processing existing crop files if available\nprint(f"\\n=== STEP 4: PROCESSING EXISTING CROP FILES ===\\n")\n\nif crop_files:\n print(f"Found {len(crop_files)} existing crop files to analyze")\n \n for crop_path, crop_size, crop_file_size in crop_files:\n crop_name = os.path.basename(crop_path)\n print(f"\\nProcessing crop: {crop_name} ({crop_size[0]}x{crop_size[1]} pixels)")\n \n # Try MarkItDown on crop if available\n if \'md\' in locals():\n try:\n crop_result = md.convert(crop_path)\n crop_text = crop_result.text_content if hasattr(crop_result, \'text_content\') else str(crop_result)\n \n if crop_text and len(crop_text.strip()) > 5:\n print(f" ‚úì MarkItDown extracted {len(crop_text)} characters from crop")\n \n if \'economic\' in crop_text.lower() and \'crunch\' in crop_text.lower():\n print(f" üéØ FOUND ECONOMIC CRUNCH in crop {crop_name}!")\n \n # Save crop result\n crop_result_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f\'ECONOMIC_CRUNCH_CROP_{crop_name}.txt\')\n with open(crop_result_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"ECONOMIC CRUNCH FOUND IN CROP: {crop_name}\\n")\n f.write(f"Extracted on: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\\n")\n f.write(f"{\'=\'*50}\\n\\n")\n f.write(crop_text)\n \n print(f" Economic Crunch crop saved to: {crop_result_file}")\n \n # Quick rhyme analysis\n crop_lines = [line.strip() for line in crop_text.split(\'\\n\') if line.strip()]\n rhyme_candidates = []\n \n for line in crop_lines:\n if (len(line) > 5 and len(line) < 100 and\n any(c.isalpha() for c in line) and\n not any(skip in line.lower() for skip in [\'economic crunch\', \'discontinued\', \'ben\', \'jerry\'])):\n rhyme_candidates.append(line)\n \n if rhyme_candidates:\n last_line = rhyme_candidates[-1]\n print(f" *** POTENTIAL LAST LINE FROM CROP: ***")\n print(f\' "{last_line}"\')\n \n except Exception as crop_error:\n print(f" Error processing crop with MarkItDown: {crop_error}")\nelse:\n print("No existing crop files found")\n\n# STEP 5: Manual examination guidance\nprint(f"\\n=== STEP 5: MANUAL EXAMINATION GUIDANCE ===\\n")\n\nprint("If automated OCR methods haven\'t succeeded, here\'s what we have:")\nprint(f"üì∑ Main screenshot: {target_screenshot}")\nprint(f"üìÅ Workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\n\nif os.path.exists(workspace_dir):\n text_files = [f for f in os.listdir(workspace_dir) if f.endswith(\'.txt\')]\n if text_files:\n print(f"\\nüìÑ Text extraction files available for manual review:")\n for text_file in text_files:\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, text_file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f" - {text_file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")\n\nprint(f"\\nüí° Next steps if automated extraction failed:")\nprint(f"1. Manually examine the screenshot file to locate Economic Crunch headstone")\nprint(f"2. Read the rhyme text visible on the headstone image")\nprint(f"3. Identify the last line of the rhyme")\nprint(f"4. The answer should be the final line of poetry on the Economic Crunch headstone")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== ALTERNATIVE OCR EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===")',
"description": "Comprehensive alternative OCR approach using Microsoft's MarkItDown toolkit and pytesseract as fallback methods to extract the Economic Crunch headstone rhyme text. This code: (1) Analyzes the workspace to locate the existing full page screenshot and any crop files from previous attempts, (2) Attempts to use Microsoft MarkItDown (a robust document parsing toolkit with OCR capabilities) to extract text from the screenshot, (3) Falls back to pytesseract OCR if MarkItDown is unavailable or fails, (4) Processes any existing crop files with the available OCR methods, (5) Specifically searches all extracted text for 'Economic Crunch' content and analyzes it for rhyme structure, (6) Identifies potential rhyme lines by filtering out header content and extracts the last line of the rhyme. "role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nimport re\n\nprint("=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF EXISTING OCR EXTRACTION FILES ===")\nprint("Strategy: Manually examine all OCR result files for Economic Crunch content")\nprint("Objective: Find the rhyme text that may have been missed by automated detection\\n")\n\n# Ensure workspace directory exists\nworkspace_dir = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\n# STEP 1: Inventory and analyze all text extraction files\nprint("=== STEP 1: COMPREHENSIVE TEXT FILE ANALYSIS ===\\n")\n\nif os.path.exists(workspace_dir):\n all_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir)\n text_files = [f for f in all_files if f.endswith(\'.txt\')]\n \n print(f"Found {len(text_files)} text extraction files to analyze:")\n \n for i, text_file in enumerate(text_files, 1):\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, text_file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f" {i:2d}. {text_file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")\n \n print(f"\\n=== DETAILED CONTENT ANALYSIS ===\\n")\n \n all_extracted_content = []\n economic_crunch_mentions = []\n \n for i, text_file in enumerate(text_files, 1):\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, text_file)\n \n print(f"{i}. ANALYZING: {text_file}")\n print(f" {\'=\'*50}")\n \n try:\n with open(file_path, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n content = f.read()\n \n print(f" Content length: {len(content):,} characters")\n \n # Check for Economic Crunch mentions\n content_lower = content.lower()\n has_economic = \'economic\' in content_lower\n has_crunch = \'crunch\' in content_lower\n \n if has_economic or has_crunch:\n print(f" üéØ CONTAINS RELEVANT TERMS: economic={has_economic}, crunch={has_crunch}")\n \n if has_economic and has_crunch:\n print(f" *** CONTAINS BOTH \'ECONOMIC\' AND \'CRUNCH\' ***")\n economic_crunch_mentions.append({\n \'file\': text_file,\n \'path\': file_path,\n \'content\': content\n })\n \n # Show content preview\n lines = content.split(\'\\n\')\n content_lines = [line.strip() for line in lines if line.strip()]\n \n print(f" Content broken into {len(content_lines)} non-empty lines")\n \n # Show first few meaningful lines (skip headers)\n meaningful_lines = []\n for line in content_lines:\n if not line.startswith((\'=\', \'-\', \'EXTRACTED\', \'Source:\', \'Analyzed\', \'OCR\', \'MARKITDOWN\', \'PYTESSERACT\')):\n meaningful_lines.append(line)\n if len(meaningful_lines) >= 10: # Show first 10 meaningful lines\n break\n \n if meaningful_lines:\n print(f" First {len(meaningful_lines)} meaningful lines:")\n for j, line in enumerate(meaningful_lines, 1):\n print(f" {j:2d}. {line[:80]}{\'...\' if len(line) > 80 else \'\'}")\n else:\n print(f" No meaningful content lines found (may be headers only)")\n \n # Store all content for comprehensive analysis\n all_extracted_content.append({\n \'file\': text_file,\n \'content\': content,\n \'lines\': content_lines,\n \'meaningful_lines\': meaningful_lines\n })\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f" ‚ùå Error reading file: {e}")\n \n print() # Blank line between files\n \n # STEP 2: Focus on files that mention Economic Crunch\n print(f"=== STEP 2: ECONOMIC CRUNCH CONTENT ANALYSIS ===\\n")\n \n if economic_crunch_mentions:\n print(f"üéâ Found {len(economic_crunch_mentions)} file(s) mentioning Economic Crunch!")\n \n for mention in economic_crunch_mentions:\n print(f"\\nüìÑ ANALYZING: {mention[\'file\']}")\n print(f" {\'=\'*60}")\n \n content = mention[\'content\']\n lines = [line.strip() for line in content.split(\'\\n\') if line.strip()]\n \n # Find Economic Crunch context\n economic_crunch_context = []\n found_economic_crunch = False\n \n for i, line in enumerate(lines):\n line_lower = line.lower()\n \n if \'economic\' in line_lower and \'crunch\' in line_lower:\n print(f" üéØ Found Economic Crunch at line {i+1}: {line}")\n \n # Get context around this line (before and after)\n start_idx = max(0, i-3)\n end_idx = min(len(lines), i+10)\n \n context_lines = lines[start_idx:end_idx]\n economic_crunch_context.extend(context_lines)\n found_economic_crunch = True\n \n if found_economic_crunch and economic_crunch_context:\n print(f"\\n üìù ECONOMIC CRUNCH CONTEXT ({len(economic_crunch_context)} lines):")\n \n for j, context_line in enumerate(economic_crunch_context, 1):\n print(f" {j:2d}. {context_line}")\n \n # Look for rhyme/poem structure\n print(f"\\n üéµ ANALYZING FOR RHYME STRUCTURE:")\n \n potential_rhyme_lines = []\n \n for line in economic_crunch_context:\n line_clean = line.strip()\n line_lower = line_clean.lower()\n \n # Skip obvious headers/metadata\n skip_terms = [\'economic crunch\', \'discontinued\', \'ben\', \'jerry\', \'flavor\', \'graveyard\', \n \'tombstone\', \'year\', \'date\', \'extracted\', \'source\', \'ocr\', \'analysis\']\n \n if any(term in line_lower for term in skip_terms):\n continue\n \n # Look for potential rhyme lines\n if (len(line_clean) > 8 and len(line_clean) < 150 and # Reasonable length\n any(c.isalpha() for c in line_clean) and # Contains letters\n \' \' in line_clean and # Multiple words\n not line_clean.startswith((\'=\', \'-\', \'EXTRACTED\', \'Source\'))): # Not metadata\n \n potential_rhyme_lines.append(line_clean)\n \n if potential_rhyme_lines:\n print(f" ‚úì Found {len(potential_rhyme_lines)} potential rhyme lines:")\n \n for k, rhyme_line in enumerate(potential_rhyme_lines, 1):\n print(f" {k}. {rhyme_line}")\n \n # The last line is our target!\n if potential_rhyme_lines:\n last_line = potential_rhyme_lines[-1]\n \n print(f"\\n üèÜ IDENTIFIED LAST LINE OF RHYME:")\n print(f" \\"{last_line}\\"")\n \n # Save the final answer\n final_answer = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'plan_objective\': \'Extract the last line of rhyme text from Ben & Jerry\\\'s oldest discontinued flavor headstone\',\n \'oldest_flavor\': \'Economic Crunch\',\n \'year_discontinued\': \'1987\',\n \'extraction_method\': f\'Manual analysis of existing OCR file: {mention["file"]}\',\n \'source_file\': mention[\'file\'],\n \'complete_context\': economic_crunch_context,\n \'identified_rhyme_lines\': potential_rhyme_lines,\n \'last_line_of_rhyme\': last_line,\n \'plan_status\': \'SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED\',\n \'confidence\': \'High - Found Economic Crunch content in existing OCR extraction\'\n }\n \n final_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ECONOMIC_CRUNCH_FINAL_SUCCESS.json\')\n with open(final_file, \'w\') as f:\n json.dump(final_answer, f, indent=2)\n \n print(f"\\n üíæ Final answer saved to: {final_file}")\n \n print(f"\\n{\'=\'*80}")\n print("üéâ PLAN OBJECTIVE SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED! üéâ")\n print(f"{\'=\'*80}")\n print(f"‚úì Located Ben & Jerry\'s official flavor graveyard")\n print(f"‚úì Identified Economic Crunch (1987) as oldest discontinued flavor")\n print(f"‚úì Successfully found Economic Crunch content in existing OCR extraction")\n print(f"‚úì Identified complete rhyme structure from headstone")\n print(f"‚úì Successfully extracted the last line of the rhyme")\n print(f"\\nüéØ FINAL ANSWER - LAST LINE OF ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE RHYME:")\n print(f"\\n \\"{last_line}\\"\\n")\n print(f"üìÅ Source: {mention[\'file\']}")\n print(f"{\'=\'*80}")\n \n # Mission accomplished!\n break\n else:\n print(f" ‚ùå No clear rhyme structure found in this context")\n else:\n print(f"‚ùå No files found containing both \'economic\' and \'crunch\'")\n \n # STEP 3: Broader search for any flavor-related content\n print(f"\\n=== STEP 3: BROADER FLAVOR CONTENT SEARCH ===\\n")\n \n flavor_related_content = []\n \n for content_info in all_extracted_content:\n content_lower = content_info[\'content\'].lower()\n \n # Look for any flavor-related terms\n flavor_terms = [\'flavor\', \'discontinued\', \'graveyard\', \'tombstone\', \'headstone\', \n \'ben\', \'jerry\', \'ice cream\', \'crunch\', \'economic\']\n \n found_terms = [term for term in flavor_terms if term in content_lower]\n \n if found_terms:\n flavor_related_content.append({\n \'file\': content_info[\'file\'],\n \'found_terms\': found_terms,\n \'content\': content_info[\'content\'],\n \'meaningful_lines\': content_info[\'meaningful_lines\']\n })\n \n if flavor_related_content:\n print(f"Found {len(flavor_related_content)} files with flavor-related content:")\n \n for content in flavor_related_content:\n print(f"\\nüìÑ {content[\'file\']}:")\n print(f" Terms found: {\', \'.join(content[\'found_terms\'])}")\n \n if content[\'meaningful_lines\']:\n print(f" Sample content:")\n for line in content[\'meaningful_lines\'][:5]: # Show first 5 lines\n print(f" - {line[:100]}{\'...\' if len(line) > 100 else \'\'}")\n else:\n print(f"No flavor-related content found in any OCR files")\n \n # STEP 4: Summary and next steps\n print(f"\\n=== STEP 4: ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===\\n")\n \n print(f"üìä EXTRACTION SUMMARY:")\n print(f" Total text files analyzed: {len(text_files)}")\n print(f" Files mentioning Economic Crunch: {len(economic_crunch_mentions)}")\n print(f" Files with flavor-related content: {len(flavor_related_content) if \'flavor_related_content\' in locals() else 0}")\n \n if not economic_crunch_mentions:\n print(f"\\nüí° RECOMMENDATIONS:")\n print(f" 1. {
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom PIL import Image, ImageEnhance\nimport requests\nfrom dotenv import load_dotenv\nimport base64\n\nload_dotenv()\n\nprint("=== DIRECT ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE IMAGE EXTRACTION ===")\nprint("Strategy: Use the direct headstone image URL found in previous analysis")\nprint("Objective: Download and OCR the specific Economic Crunch headstone image\\n")\n\n# Ensure workspace directory exists\nworkspace_dir = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\n# STEP 1: Use the Economic Crunch headstone URL found in previous analysis\nprint("=== STEP 1: DIRECT HEADSTONE IMAGE DOWNLOAD ===\\n")\n\n# From the previous analysis, we found this direct URL to the Economic Crunch headstone\nheadstone_url = "https://www.benjerry.com/files/live/sites/systemsite/files/US%20and%20Global%20Assets/Flavors/Graveyard/tombstones_2023_0042_graveyard_economic_crunch.jpg"\n\nprint(f"Direct Economic Crunch headstone URL: {headstone_url}")\n\ntry:\n # Download the headstone image directly\n headers = {\n \'User-Agent\': \'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36\'\n }\n \n print("Downloading Economic Crunch headstone image...")\n response = requests.get(headstone_url, headers=headers, timeout=30)\n response.raise_for_status()\n \n # Save the original headstone image\n original_headstone_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'economic_crunch_headstone_original.jpg\')\n with open(original_headstone_path, \'wb\') as f:\n f.write(response.content)\n \n print(f"‚úì Downloaded headstone image: {len(response.content):,} bytes")\n print(f"Saved to: {original_headstone_path}")\n \n # Analyze the downloaded image\n with Image.open(original_headstone_path) as img:\n print(f"Image dimensions: {img.size[0]} x {img.size[1]} pixels")\n print(f"Image format: {img.format}")\n print(f"Image mode: {img.mode}")\n \n # Convert to RGB if needed\n if img.mode != \'RGB\':\n img = img.convert(\'RGB\')\n \n # Create enhanced versions for OCR\n print("\\nCreating enhanced versions for OCR...")\n \n # Version 1: High contrast for text clarity\n contrast_enhanced = ImageEnhance.Contrast(img).enhance(2.5)\n sharpness_enhanced = ImageEnhance.Sharpness(contrast_enhanced).enhance(3.0)\n enhanced_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'economic_crunch_enhanced.jpg\')\n sharpness_enhanced.save(enhanced_path, \'JPEG\', quality=95)\n print(f"Enhanced version saved: {enhanced_path}")\n \n # Version 2: Larger size for better OCR\n if img.width < 1000 or img.height < 1000:\n scale_factor = max(1000 / img.width, 1000 / img.height)\n new_width = int(img.width * scale_factor)\n new_height = int(img.height * scale_factor)\n \n enlarged = img.resize((new_width, new_height), Image.Resampling.LANCZOS)\n enlarged_enhanced = ImageEnhance.Contrast(enlarged).enhance(2.0)\n enlarged_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'economic_crunch_enlarged.jpg\')\n enlarged_enhanced.save(enlarged_path, \'JPEG\', quality=95)\n print(f"Enlarged version saved: {enlarged_path} ({new_width}x{new_height})")\n else:\n enlarged_path = enhanced_path\n print(f"Image already large enough, using enhanced version")\n \n # Version 3: Grayscale with high contrast\n gray_img = img.convert(\'L\')\n contrast_gray = ImageEnhance.Contrast(gray_img).enhance(3.0)\n gray_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'economic_crunch_gray.jpg\')\n contrast_gray.save(gray_path, \'JPEG\', quality=95)\n print(f"Grayscale version saved: {gray_path}")\n \nexcept Exception as download_error:\n print(f"Error downloading headstone image: {download_error}")\n print("Will try to use existing screenshot crops instead...")\n \n # Fallback: look for existing Economic Crunch headstone files\n existing_files = []\n if os.path.exists(workspace_dir):\n for file in os.listdir(workspace_dir):\n if \'economic_crunch\' in file.lower() and file.endswith((\'.png\', \'.jpg\', \'.jpeg\')):\n existing_files.append(os.path.join(workspace_dir, file))\n \n if existing_files:\n print(f"\\nFound {len(existing_files)} existing Economic Crunch image files:")\n for file in existing_files:\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file)\n print(f" - {os.path.basename(file)}: {file_size:,} bytes")\n \n # Use the largest existing file\n original_headstone_path = max(existing_files, key=os.path.getsize)\n enhanced_path = original_headstone_path\n enlarged_path = original_headstone_path\n gray_path = original_headstone_path\n print(f"Using existing file: {original_headstone_path}")\n else:\n print("No existing Economic Crunch headstone files found")\n exit()\n\n# STEP 2: Try multiple OCR services on the headstone image\nprint(f"\\n=== STEP 2: COMPREHENSIVE OCR ANALYSIS ===\\n")\n\nocr_results = []\nimage_versions = [\n (\'Original\', original_headstone_path),\n (\'Enhanced\', enhanced_path),\n (\'Enlarged\', enlarged_path),\n (\'Grayscale\', gray_path)\n]\n\n# Method 1: Try pytesseract if available\nprint("Method 1: pytesseract OCR...")\ntry:\n import pytesseract\n \n for version_name, image_path in image_versions:\n if os.path.exists(image_path):\n print(f" Processing {version_name} version with pytesseract...")\n \n with Image.open(image_path) as img:\n # Try different OCR configurations\n configs = [\n \'--psm 6\', # Uniform block of text\n \'--psm 7\', # Single text line\n \'--psm 8\', # Single word\n \'--psm 13\' # Raw line, treat as single text line\n ]\n \n for config in configs:\n try:\n extracted_text = pytesseract.image_to_string(img, config=config)\n \n if extracted_text and len(extracted_text.strip()) > 5:\n print(f" ‚úì Config {config}: extracted {len(extracted_text)} characters")\n \n ocr_results.append({\n \'method\': f\'pytesseract_{config.replace("--psm ", "psm")}\',\n \'version\': version_name,\n \'text\': extracted_text,\n \'length\': len(extracted_text)\n })\n \n # Save result\n result_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f\'tesseract_{version_name.lower()}_{config.replace("--psm ", "psm")}.txt\')\n with open(result_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"PYTESSERACT OCR - {version_name.upper()} - {config}\\n")\n f.write(f"Extracted on: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\\n")\n f.write(f"Source: {image_path}\\n")\n f.write(f"{\'=\'*60}\\n\\n")\n f.write(extracted_text)\n \n print(f" Saved to: {result_file}")\n \n # Show preview\n preview = extracted_text.strip()[:150] + \'...\' if len(extracted_text.strip()) > 150 else extracted_text.strip()\n print(f" Preview: {preview}")\n else:\n print(f" Config {config}: no meaningful text extracted")\n \n except Exception as config_error:\n print(f" Config {config} error: {config_error}")\n \nexcept ImportError:\n print(" pytesseract not available")\nexcept Exception as tesseract_error:\n print(f" pytesseract error: {tesseract_error}")\n\n# Method 2: Try EasyOCR if available\nprint("\\nMethod 2: EasyOCR...")\ntry:\n import easyocr\n \n # Initialize EasyOCR reader\n reader = easyocr.Reader([\'en\'])\n \n for version_name, image_path in image_versions[:2]: # Try on first 2 versions\n if os.path.exists(image_path):\n print(f" Processing {version_name} version with EasyOCR...")\n \n try:\n results = reader.readtext(image_path)\n \n if results:\n extracted_text = \' \'.join([result[1] for result in results])\n confidence_scores = [result[2] for result in results]\n avg_confidence = sum(confidence_scores) / len(confidence_scores)\n \n print(f" ‚úì EasyOCR extracted {len(extracted_text)} characters (confidence: {avg_confidence:.2f})")\n \n ocr_results.append({\n \'method\': \'easyocr\',\n \'version\': version_name,\n \'text\': extracted_text,\n \'length\': len(extracted_text),\n \'confidence\': avg_confidence\n })\n \n # Save result\n result_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f\'easyocr_{version_name.lower()}.txt\')\n with open(result_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"EASYOCR - {version_name.upper()}\\n")\n f.write(f"Extracted on: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\\n")\n f.write(f"Average confidence: {avg_confidence:.2f}\\n")\n f.write(f"Source: {image_path}\\n")\n f.write(f"{\'=\'*60}\\n\\n")\n f.write(extracted_text)\n f.write(f"\\n\\nDetailed results:\\n")\n for i, result in enumerate(results, 1):\n f.write(f"{i}. Text: \'{result[1]}\' (confidence: {result[2]:.2f})\\n")\n \n print(f" Saved to: {result_file}")\n \n # Show preview\n preview = extracted_text[:150] + \'...\' if len(extracted_text) > 150 else extracted_text\n print(f" Preview: {preview}")\n else:\n print(f" EasyOCR: no text detected")\n \n except Exception as easy_error:\n print(f" EasyOCR error: {easy_error}")\n \nexcept ImportError:\n print(" EasyOCR not available")\nexcept Exception as easyocr_error:\n print(f" EasyOCR setup error: {easyocr_error}")\n\n# Method 3: Try MarkItDown on the headstone image\nprint("\\nMethod 3: MarkItDown...")\ntry:\n from markitdown import MarkItDown\n \n md = MarkItDown()\n \n for version_name, image_path in image_versions[:2]: # Try on first 2 versions\n if os.path.exists(image_path):\n print(f" Processing {version_name} version with MarkItDown...")\n \n try:\n result = md.convert(image_path)\n extracted_text = result.text_content if hasattr(result, \'text_content\') else str(result)\n \n if extracted_text and len(extracted_text.strip()) > 5:\n print(f" ‚úì MarkItDown extracted {len(extracted_text)} characters")\n \n ocr_results.append({\n \'method\': \'markitdown\',\n \'version\': version_name,\n \'text\': extracted_text,\n \'length\': len(extracted_text)\n })\n \n # Save result\n result_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f\'markitdown_{version_name.lower()}.txt\')\n with open(result_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"MARKITDOWN - {version_name.upper()}\\n")\n f.write(f"Extracted on: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\\n")\n f.write(f"Source: {image_path}\\n")\n f.write(f"{\'=\'*60}\\n\\n")\n f.write(extracted_text)\n \n print(f" Saved to: {result_file}")\n \n # Show preview\n preview = extracted_text.strip()[:150] + \'...\' if len(extracted_text.strip()) > 150 else extracted_text.strip()\n print(f" Preview: {preview}")\n else:\n print(f" MarkItDown: no meaningful text extracted")\n \n except Exception as md_error:\n print(f" MarkItDown error: {md_error}")\n \nexcept ImportError:\n print(" MarkItDown not available")\nexcept Exception as markitdown_error:\n print(f" MarkItDown setup error: {markitdown_error}")\n\n# STEP 3: Analyze all OCR results for rhyme content\nprint(f"\\n=== STEP 3: RHYME TEXT ANALYSIS ===\\n")\n\nif ocr_results:\n print(f"Total OCR results: {len(ocr_results)}")\n \n best_result = None\n \n for i, result in enumerate(ocr_results, 1):\n print(f"\\n{i}. {result[\'method\']} - {result[\'version\']} ({result[\'length\']} chars)")\n \n text = result[\'text\']\n lines = [line.strip() for line in text.split(\'\\n\') if line.strip()]\n \n print(f" Text broken into {len(lines)} lines:")\n for j, line in enumerate(lines[:10], 1): # Show first 10 lines\n print(f" {j:2d}. {line}")\n \n # Look for rhyme content\n rhyme_candidates = []\n \n for line in lines:\n line_clean = line.strip()\n line_lower = line_clean.lower()\n \n # Skip obvious headers/titles\n skip_terms = [\'economic crunch\', \'discontinued\', \'ben\', \'jerry\', \'flavor\', \'graveyard\']\n \n if any(term in line_lower for term in skip_terms):\n continue\n \n # Look for potential rhyme lines\n if (len(line_clean) > 8 and len(line_clean) < 120 and\n any(c.isalpha() for c in line_clean) and\n \' \' in line_clean):\n \n rhyme_candidates.append(line_clean)\n \n if rhyme_candidates:\n print(f" üéØ Found {len(rhyme_candidates)} potential rhyme lines:")\n for k, rhyme_line in enumerate(rhyme_candidates, 1):\n print(f" {k}. {rhyme_line}")\n \n # The last line is our target\n last_line = rhyme_candidates[-1]\n \n print(f"\\n *** LAST LINE OF RHYME: ***")\n print(f\' "{last_line}"\')\n \n # This is our best result\n best_result = {\n \'method\': result[\'method\'],\n \'version\': result[\'version\'],\n \'complete_text\': text,\n \'rhyme_lines\': rhyme_candidates,\n \'last_line\': last_line\n }\n \n break # Found rhyme content, use this result\n \n # Save final answer if we found rhyme content\n if best_result:\n final_answer = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'plan_objective\': \'Extract the last line of rhyme text from Ben & Jerry\\\'s oldest discontinued flavor headstone\',\n \'oldest_flavor\': \'Economic Crunch\',\n \'year_discontinued\': \'1987\',\n \'extraction_method\': f\'Direct headstone image OCR via {best_result["method"]} on {best_result["version"]} version\',\n \'headstone_image_url\': headstone_url if \'headstone_url\' in locals() else \'Direct image processing\',\n \'complete_headstone_text\': best_result[\'complete_text\'],\n \'identified_rhyme_lines\': best_result[\'rhyme_lines\'],\n \'last_line_of_rhyme\': best_result[\'last_line\'],\n \'plan_status\': \'SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED\',\n \'confidence\': \'High - Successfully extracted rhyme from direct headstone image\'\n }\n \n final_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'ECONOMIC_CRUNCH_DIRECT_EXTRACTION_FINAL.json\')\n with open(final_file, \'w\') as f:\n json.dump(final_answer, f, indent=2)\n \n print(f"\\n{\'=\'*80}")\n print("üéâ PLAN OBJECTIVE SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED! üéâ")\n print(f"{\'=\'*80}")\n print(f"‚úì Located Ben & Jerry\'s official flavor graveyard")\n print(f"‚úì Identified Economic Crunch (1987) as oldest discontinued flavor")\n print(f"‚úì Downloaded direct headstone image from Ben & Jerry\'s website")\n print(f"‚úì Applied multiple OCR methods to extract headstone text")\n print(f"‚úì Identified complete rhyme structure")\n print(f"‚úì Successfully extracted the last line of the rhyme")\n print(f"\\nüéØ FINAL ANSWER - LAST LINE OF ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE RHYME:")\n print(f\'\\n "{best_result["last_line"]}"\\n\')\n print(f"Method: {best_result[\'method\']} on {best_result[\'version\']} version")\n print(f"Final answer saved to: {final_file}")\n print(f"{\'=\'*80}")\n else:\n print(f"\\n‚ö†Ô∏è OCR extracted text but no clear rhyme structure found")\n \n # Show what we did extract for manual review\n if ocr_results:\n print(f"\\nExtracted content for manual review:")\n for result in ocr_results[:3]: # Show first 3 results\n preview = result[\'text\'][:200] + \'...\' if len(result[\'text\']) > 200 else result[\'text\']\n print(f"\\n{result[\'method\']} - {result[\'version\']}:")\n print(f"{preview}")\nelse:\n print(f"‚ùå No text was successfully extracted from the headstone image")\n print(f"The headstone image may contain stylized text that\'s difficult for OCR")\n print(f"Manual examination of the headstone image may be required")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== DIRECT HEADSTONE EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===")',

{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom PIL import Image\nimport base64\nimport requests\nfrom dotenv import load_dotenv\n\nload_dotenv()\n\nprint("=== GPT-4 VISION ANALYSIS OF ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE ===")\nprint("Strategy: Use GPT-4 Vision to directly read the rhyme text from headstone images")\nprint("Objective: Extract the complete rhyme and identify the last line\\n")\n\n# Ensure workspace directory exists\nworkspace_dir = \'workspace\'\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n\n# STEP 1: Locate the best headstone image files\nprint("=== STEP 1: LOCATING HEADSTONE IMAGE FILES ===\\n")\n\nheadstone_images = []\nif os.path.exists(workspace_dir):\n for file in os.listdir(workspace_dir):\n if (\'economic_crunch\' in file.lower() or \'headstone\' in file.lower()) and file.endswith((\'.png\', \'.jpg\', \'.jpeg\')):\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n \n try:\n with Image.open(file_path) as img:\n headstone_images.append({\n \'name\': file,\n \'path\': file_path,\n \'size\': file_size,\n \'dimensions\': img.size,\n \'format\': img.format\n })\n print(f"Found: {file} - {img.size[0]}x{img.size[1]} pixels, {file_size:,} bytes")\n except Exception as e:\n print(f"Error reading {file}: {e}")\n\n# Also check for the main screenshot\nscreenshot_path = None\nfor file in os.listdir(workspace_dir):\n if \'screenshot\' in file.lower() and file.endswith(\'.png\'):\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)\n try:\n with Image.open(file_path) as img:\n if img.size[0] > 3000: # Large screenshot\n screenshot_path = file_path\n print(f"\\nFound main screenshot: {file} - {img.size[0]}x{img.size[1]} pixels")\n break\n except:\n continue\n\nprint(f"\\nTotal headstone images found: {len(headstone_images)}")\n\n# STEP 2: Use GPT-4 Vision to analyze the images\nprint(f"\\n=== STEP 2: GPT-4 VISION ANALYSIS ===\\n")\n\n# Get API credentials\napi_key = os.getenv("OPENAI_API_KEY")\napi_base = os.getenv("OPENAI_BASE_URL")\n\nif not api_key or not api_base:\n print("‚ùå Missing OpenAI API credentials")\n exit()\n\n# Try the headstone images first, then screenshot if needed\nanalysis_targets = []\n\n# Add headstone images (prioritize larger ones)\nheadstone_images.sort(key=lambda x: x[\'size\'], reverse=True)\nfor img_info in headstone_images[:3]: # Try top 3 headstone images\n analysis_targets.append((\'Headstone Image\', img_info[\'path\'], img_info[\'name\']))\n\n# Add screenshot as fallback\nif screenshot_path:\n analysis_targets.append((\'Full Screenshot\', screenshot_path, \'full_page_screenshot.png\'))\n\nsuccessful_extraction = None\n\nfor target_type, image_path, image_name in analysis_targets:\n print(f"\\nAnalyzing {target_type}: {image_name}")\n \n try:\n # Load and encode image\n with open(image_path, "rb") as f:\n image_data = f.read()\n \n # Determine image type\n img_type = "data:image/jpeg;base64," if image_path.lower().endswith((\'.jpg\', \'.jpeg\')) else "data:image/png;base64,"\n img_base64 = base64.b64encode(image_data).decode("utf-8")\n \n print(f" Image encoded: {len(image_data):,} bytes")\n \n # Create specific prompt for Economic Crunch headstone\n if target_type == \'Headstone Image\':\n prompt = (\n "This image shows the Economic Crunch headstone from Ben & Jerry\'s Flavor Graveyard. "\n "Please carefully examine this headstone image and extract ALL visible text, especially focusing on:\\n\\n"\n "1. The flavor name \'Economic Crunch\'\\n"\n "2. Any rhyme or poem text written on the headstone\\n"\n "3. The complete rhyme structure from first line to last line\\n\\n"\n "Please transcribe the complete rhyme text exactly as it appears, line by line. "\n "Pay special attention to the LAST LINE of the rhyme, as this is what we need to identify.\\n\\n"\n "Format your response as:\\n"\n "**Flavor Name:** [name]\\n"\n "**Complete Rhyme Text:**\\n"\n "[line 1]\\n"\n "[line 2]\\n"\n "[etc.]\\n\\n"\n "**Last Line of Rhyme:** [the final line]"\n )\n else:\n prompt = (\n "This is a screenshot of Ben & Jerry\'s Flavor Graveyard webpage. Please locate the Economic Crunch headstone "\n "and extract the rhyme text from it. Economic Crunch is the oldest discontinued flavor from 1987. \\n\\n"\n "Look for a headstone/tombstone image with \'Economic Crunch\' and read the rhyme text written on it. "\n "Extract the complete rhyme and identify the last line.\\n\\n"\n "Format your response as:\\n"\n "**Found Economic Crunch:** [Yes/No]\\n"\n "**Complete Rhyme Text:**\\n"\n "[rhyme lines]\\n\\n"\n "**Last Line of Rhyme:** [the final line]"\n )\n \n # Prepare API request\n payload = {\n "model": "gpt-4o-0806",\n "messages": [\n {\n "role": "user",\n "content": [\n {\n "type": "text",\n "text": prompt\n },\n {\n "type": "image_url",\n "image_url": {\n "url": f"{img_type}{img_base64}"\n }\n }\n ]\n }\n ],\n "max_tokens": 4096\n }\n \n headers = {\n "Content-Type": "application/json",\n "Authorization": f"Bearer {api_key}"\n }\n \n print(f" Sending to GPT-4 Vision...")\n response = requests.post(f"{api_base}/chat/completions", headers=headers, json=payload, timeout=60)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n result = response.json()\n \n if "choices" in result and len(result["choices"]) > 0:\n analysis_text = result["choices"][0]["message"]["content"]\n \n print(f" ‚úì GPT-4 Vision analysis received ({len(analysis_text)} characters)")\n \n # Save the analysis\n analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f\'gpt4_vision_{target_type.lower().replace(" ", "_")}_{image_name.replace(".", "_")}.txt\')\n with open(analysis_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"GPT-4 VISION ANALYSIS - {target_type.upper()}\\n")\n f.write(f"Image: {image_name}\\n")\n f.write(f"Analysis Date: {datetime.now().isoformat()}\\n")\n f.write(f"{\'=\'*60}\\n\\n")\n f.write(analysis_text)\n \n print(f" Analysis saved to: {analysis_file}")\n \n # Check if this contains rhyme content\n analysis_lower = analysis_text.lower()\n if \'economic crunch\' in analysis_lower and (\'rhyme\' in analysis_lower or \'line\' in analysis_lower):\n print(f" üéØ FOUND ECONOMIC CRUNCH RHYME CONTENT!")\n \n # Extract the last line\n lines = analysis_text.split(\'\\n\')\n \n # Look for "Last Line" or similar patterns\n last_line = None\n rhyme_lines = []\n \n for i, line in enumerate(lines):\n line_clean = line.strip()\n \n # Look for last line indicator\n if \'last line\' in line_clean.lower() and \':\' in line_clean:\n # Extract text after the colon\n last_line = line_clean.split(\':\', 1)[1].strip()\n if last_line.startswith(\'[\') and last_line.endswith(\']\'):\n last_line = last_line[1:-1] # Remove brackets\n break\n \n # Also collect rhyme lines\n if line_clean and not line_clean.startswith(\'**\') and not line_clean.startswith(\'=\'):\n if len(line_clean) > 5 and any(c.isalpha() for c in line_clean):\n rhyme_lines.append(line_clean)\n \n # If no explicit "last line" found, use the last rhyme line\n if not last_line and rhyme_lines:\n last_line = rhyme_lines[-1]\n \n if last_line:\n print(f"\\n *** EXTRACTED LAST LINE: ***")\n print(f\' "{last_line}"\')\n \n # Save final answer\n final_answer = {\n \'analysis_date\': datetime.now().isoformat(),\n \'plan_objective\': \'Extract the last line of rhyme text from Ben & Jerry\\\'s oldest discontinued flavor headstone\',\n \'oldest_flavor\': \'Economic Crunch\',\n \'year_discontinued\': \'1987\',\n \'extraction_method\': f\'GPT-4 Vision analysis of {target_type}: {image_name}\',\n \'source_image\': image_path,\n \'complete_gpt4_analysis\': analysis_text,\n \'extracted_rhyme_lines\': rhyme_lines,\n \'last_line_of_rhyme\': last_line,\n \'plan_status\': \'SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED\',\n \'confidence\': \'High - GPT-4 Vision successfully read headstone text\'\n }\n \n final_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'GPT4_VISION_ECONOMIC_CRUNCH_FINAL_SUCCESS.json\')\n with open(final_file, \'w\') as f:\n json.dump(final_answer, j, indent=2)\n \n print(f"\\n{\'=\'*80}")\n print("üéâ PLAN OBJECTIVE SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED! üéâ")\n print(f"{\'=\'*80}")\n print(f"‚úì Located Ben & Jerry\'s official flavor graveyard")\n print(f"‚úì Identified Economic Crunch (1987) as oldest discontinued flavor")\n print(f"‚úì Successfully used GPT-4 Vision to read headstone text")\n print(f"‚úì Extracted complete rhyme structure from headstone")\n print(f"‚úì Successfully identified the last line of the rhyme")\n print(f"\\nüéØ FINAL ANSWER - LAST LINE OF ECONOMIC CRUNCH HEADSTONE RHYME:")\n print(f\'\\n "{last_line}"\\n\')\n print(f"Method: GPT-4 Vision analysis of {image_name}")\n print(f"Final answer saved to: {final_file}")\n print(f"{\'=\'*80}")\n \n successful_extraction = final_answer\n break # Success! Exit the loop\n else:\n print(f" ‚ö†Ô∏è Found Economic Crunch content but couldn\'t extract clear last line")\n else:\n print(f" No Economic Crunch rhyme content found in this analysis")\n \n # Show preview of analysis\n preview = analysis_text[:300] + \'...\' if len(analysis_text) > 300 else analysis_text\n print(f" Preview: {preview}")\n else:\n print(f" ‚ùå Invalid GPT-4 Vision response format")\n else:\n print(f" ‚ùå GPT-4 Vision API error: {response.status_code}")\n print(f" Response: {response.text[:200]}...")\n \n except Exception as vision_error:\n print(f" ‚ùå GPT-4 Vision error: {vision_error}")\n continue\n\n# STEP 3: Summary and fallback if needed\nprint(f"\\n=== STEP 3: ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===\\n")\n\nif successful_extraction:\n print(f"üéâ SUCCESS! GPT-4 Vision successfully extracted the Economic Crunch headstone rhyme.")\n print(f"Last line identified: \\"{successful_extraction[\'last_line_of_rhyme\']}\\"")\nelse:\n print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è GPT-4 Vision analysis completed but didn\'t find clear rhyme content.")\n print(f"\\nüìã ANALYSIS FILES CREATED:")\n \n # List analysis files created\n if os.path.exists(workspace_dir):\n analysis_files = [f for f in os.listdir(workspace_dir) if f.startswith(\'gpt4_vision_\') and f.endswith(\'.txt\')]\n for analysis_file in analysis_files:\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, analysis_file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f" - {analysis_file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")\n \n print(f"\\nüí° RECOMMENDATIONS:")\n print(f"1. Manually review the GPT-4 Vision analysis files for any missed rhyme content")\n print(f"2. The Economic Crunch headstone may have stylized text that\'s challenging to read")\n print(f"3. Consider examining the full screenshot manually to locate the headstone visually")\n print(f"4. The rhyme text might be partially obscured or in decorative fonts")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== GPT-4 VISION ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===")',
"description": 'Advanced GPT-4 Vision approach to directly analyze the Economic Crunch headstone images and extract the rhyme text that OCR methods have failed to capture. This code: (1) Locates all existing headstone image files and the main screenshot from previous attempts, (2) Uses GPT-4 Vision API to directly analyze the images with specific prompts designed to extract Economic Crunch headstone rhyme content, (3) Prioritizes dedicated headstone images over full screenshots for more focused analysis, (4) Applies targeted prompts that specifically request the complete rhyme text and identification of the last line, (5) Parses GPT-4 Vision responses to extract the final line of the rhyme and saves the complete analysis.
